campaign.story:
GHOSTS is a full motion video, horror game stepping into the shoes of Night Trap, Phantasmagoria and The 7th Guest. It’s a real-time live action game which means that it has to be played at 10pm in your local time zone. Written and Directed by Jed Shepherd (writer and exec producer of HOST - “The Scariest Movie of the last Decade” - Dread Central & “The Genre Phenomenon of 2020” - Forbes) in partnership with Visible Games & Limited Run Games. The game takes inspiration from the works of Manx screenwriter Nigel Kneale and the blurring of fact and fiction in the found footage movies from the last 25 years. However, unlike previous games in this oft-forgotten genre we’re creating a horror experience that aims to truly chill your blood and send full motion video games screaming into the modern day.
Starring Emma Louise Webb, Haley Bishop, Jemma Moore, Radina Drandova and Caroline Ward, GHOSTS features terrifying creature design by Trevor Henderson (SirenHead).
Hey, I’m Jed and I’m making a video game called GHOSTS.
Last Halloween, frustrated by the neverending lockdown situation in the UK, like a lot of people I turned to video games for escapism. Looking specifically for horror games to freak me out, I re-discovered the live-action video games (FMV) of the 90s. Titles like Night Trap, Phantasmagoria and Double Switch (featuring the utterly superb Corey Haim), games that dared to try something a bit different and really pushed the capabilities of the game systems of their time.
It suddenly dawned on me what I had to do - I had to make a live action video game starring my friends Emma, Haley, Jemma, Radina and Caroline and make it as scary as hell. I want to make you afraid of even looking at your Nintendo Switch but feel absolutely compelled to play the game anyway to help the ladies survive.
I contacted Visible Games to see if they were into helping me make it and posited the question: What if it was LIVE?
What if it's hard-coded into the narrative of the game that you have to play it at a certain time? What if everyone in your time zone is playing the game at exactly that moment? It would make it an unprecedented terrifying event.  Wouldn’t that be cool?  Luckily Visible Games have the unique skills to pull this concept off and make this unique feature a reality.
We took the idea to Limited Run Games and I’ve never heard a faster YES in my life. Their support has been legendary and their reputation of delivering superior games is second to none. They will be releasing the game on all formats early next year.
Building the team to help make this has been so much fun and I went to the absolute best to visualise the ‘antagonist’, THE LONG LADY. Designed by SIRENHEAD creator Trevor Henderson, I’ve genuinely got the best people on the GHOSTS train!
You’re probably thinking “Jed, why don’t you just make a movie? Why a live-action video game?”. My answer is: Why Not?
So as not to reveal too many spoilers, we have to be a little careful about the information you receive this early on. What we can say is ...
You play a TV producer, operating the outside broadcast van for a failing cable channel called FrighTV. Their flagship show is GHOSTS. It’s the only thing people want to watch on the channel anymore. A show that in its heyday captured millions of viewers on a major channel. Viewers were glued to their screens as the presenter with a team of eager ghost hunters explored haunted locations around the country.
Over the years, GHOSTS ratings began to drop which ultimately resulted in the show being dropped by the network and languishing on various freeview channels until it was purchased by FrighTV and re-branded for re-launch in 2022. The channel is littered with terrible adverts and trailers for movies you’ve never heard of and never want to watch.
As the cast explore the location, you not only need to worry about their safety, the noises you hear around the van and the strange neighbours, there’s also the urban legend of THE LONG LADY. Sightings of THE LONG LADY on this very street have chilled the bones of residents for decades. She appears in times of tragedy, looking through the windows of houses on the street. It’s said that if you look directly at her face, you die. Curtain salesmen do gangbusters here.
Evidence submitted via a recovered mobile phone
Above is photograph 2 of 3 taken from the discard mobile phone.
Photograph 3 of 3
You are the outside broadcast producer, in charge of what is shown to the viewers at home who have remained loyal to the show throughout all the lean years. The show is LIVE so you have to think on your feet and react to every moment to keep things interesting.  In front of you will be all of the camera feeds streaming from cameras installed in the most haunted location in London as well as heart rate monitors for the cast. What gets sent to the LIVE feed is your choice and can affect the future of the show (and perhaps the safety of the cast). You need to keep the show entertaining and you will have various tricks to employ to help you ‘spice up’ the live show.
You also have various documents, videos and audio files, collected throughout the years from this local community that you need to decipher to help understand the grave situation. Perhaps something you discover will stop the horrifying events from unfolding.
The full terrifying real-time version of the game is only playable at 10pm in your local time zone. If you load up the game before 10pm you’ll be met with a classic test card. If you can crack the ‘test’ you will have access to an unlockable pre-watershed version where you can breathe and save your progress, but once you hit 10pm all bets are off! There are consequences for all of your choices though. Playing it safe is not always the best option.
When playing GHOSTS, if you leave your station at any point, the game notices the lack of movement and it will end your session. Desertion of duty means the cast will be killed off. You are responsible for the lives of all involved so make sure you’ve had a bathroom break, got plenty of snacks and most importantly turn off the lights!

Haley Bishop is an American actress, based in London. She stars in BIFA nominated 'HOST' (2020) on AMC Networks' horror streaming service, SHUDDER. Other credits include Warner Brothers TOM AND JERRY (2021), ANGEL HAS FALLEN (2019), and DEEP STATE (2018).
She is also a writer and producer with SWR Media in both scripted and non scripted. Her most recent comedy, 1-800-D-Direct, premiered at the BFI in 2020 and is currently having a successful festival run, next playing at BAFTA qualifying Carmarthen Bay Film Festival.
Radina Drandova is a Bulgarian actress based in London. She graduated from the prestigious Royal Central School of Speech and Drama. Most recently starring in BIFA nominated, international cult hit sensation, ‘HOST’ (2020). Radina also stars in the short film ‘Dawn of the Deaf’ (2016) which appeared in over 100 film festivals worldwide, including Sundance. You can also catch Radina as the lead in the award winning short ‘PITFALL’ (2017) on Amazon Prime. Radina is part of an international community of artists championing truthful storytelling of the multicultural experience. She also loves pizza, sunshine and her favorite game is Unravel.
Jemma Moore stars in BIFA nominated 'HOST' which is currently 100% 'Certified Fresh' on Rotten Tomatoes and nominated as third best reviewed British film of 2020 in the Golden Tomato Awards. 'HOST' is also one of EMPIRE magazine's 'Best Movies of 2020' with Jemma's character making it into EMPIRE magazine's 'The 100 Best Horror Movie Characters' list. It was named one of TIME magazine's '17 Great Movies You may have Missed this Summer', Variety's 'Best Horror Movies of 2020' and Total Film's 'Best horror films of all time'. Jemma is also known for her roles in 'DOOM: ANNIHILATION' (2019), 'SHAKESPEARE & HATHAWAY' (2019) and 'WONDER WOMAN' (2018).
Caroline Ward is most recently known for her performance in BIFA Nominated, 'HOST'. 'HOST' is available on all major on-demand platforms, had an international cinema release in December 2020 and was released on Blu-Ray in February 2021. ‘HOST’ has been named in EMPIRE Magazine's ‘The Best Movies Of 2020’, TotalFilm’s ‘The 30 Best Horror Movies Of All Time’, Variety’s ‘Best Horror Movies of 2020’ and Certified 100% Fresh on Rotten tomatoes.
Caroline is also co-founder of It Girls Productions, a production company focusing on female-led narratives, representation and inclusivity. 2021 will see short films 'Stalling It' (It Girls Productions) and 'Third on the Left' (Blotched Ink Productions), both written and directed by Caroline, on the festival circuit.
Emma Louise Webb is an Actress of screen and stage, Musician, Commercial Model and Writer from South East London. She trained at Identity School of Acting.
Emma appeared in the TV show The Crown before moving onto features with MULTIPLEX (2020) and the horror sensation HOST (2020). Emma is featured in numerous commercials for the likes of McDonalds, Samsung and many more. Her new girl group will be launching some time in 2021.
Jed Shepherd is a screenwriter, producer and director from South London. A walking-talking encyclopedia of Horror but also still mortally afraid of the bog of Eternal Stench from Labyrinth. He is a Henson super fan and has multiple Horror films in development with Blumhouse, Sam Raimi and StudioCanal. He also finds time to consistently beat Emma at Mario Kart.
Visible Games are a UK and US based indie development studio filled to the brim with creative talent. Our team is made up of the best indie games makers we could possibly find, and one that is committed to every title we make. We also boast an in-house music production suite and love horror and gaming with every fibre of our being!  
Trevor Henderson is a writer and illustrator. His love of monsters, cryptids, ghosts and other horrible entities is enduring and vast. When he is not drawing or writing horrible things, he is thinking about the unknowable and hostile forces working against all of humanity, and playing with his cat, who is named Boo. He is available for local projects as well as potential employment opportunities.
Limited Run Games is a Raleigh-based publisher founded in 2015 that focuses on preserving games in a physical format. Publishing over 300 games in its lifetime and winning awards for its bespoke Collector’s Editions, Limited Run is the gold standard in bringing digital-only games to physical form for casual fans and collectors alike. Visit limitedrungames.com for the latest offerings, or follow the brand on your social media platform of choice for all LRG-related updates: @limitedrungames.
Graham Humphreys is an illustrator and designer with 40 years experience. One of the few contemporary illustrators using the traditional medium of gouache to paint his images, Graham is best known for his work within the horror genre. This site is both an online portfolio of work, but also a visual testament to the enduring appeal of horror through cinema and home entertainment.
We have teamed up with the legendary Limited Run Games to produce the physical items for GHOSTS. Their previous experience with fulfilment means that your physical Nintendo Switch or Playstation game will be shipped with all the care you’ve come to expect from them. It’s important to note that the exclusive Graham Humphreys artwork will only be available with these Kickstarter releases, so don’t miss out!
 GHOSTS for Nintendo Switch by Limited Run Games 
GHOSTS for Playstation by Limited Run Games 

If you want a little bit more oomph to your GHOSTS experience we have also teamed up with the amazing FRIGHT RAGS to offer an exclusive t-shirt too as part of our pledge tiers! 
GHOSTS for Playstation with exclusive Fright Rags Tee 
GHOSTS for Nintendo Switch with exclusive Fright Rags T-Shirt 

The Collectors Edition of the game features a host of items that we can’t wait for you to get your hands on. Here’s a quick rundown of everything you get!
The GHOSTS Collectors Edition by Limited Run Games 
The GHOSTS Collectors Edition by Limited Run Games comes with ...
Physical Game for Nintendo Switch or Playstation
Digital Key for GHOSTS (Switch, Playstation, PC or Xbox)
Exclusive Graham Humphreys GHOSTS Cover
GHOSTS Logo Sew on Patch
Exclusive Limited Edition GHOSTS T-Shirt from Fright Rags!
GHOSTS Sticker Sheet
The Long Lady Acrylic Standee
VHS Collectors Edition GHOSTS Clamshell Case (to hold all the contents)
Documentary ‘The Making of GHOSTS’ on Blu-Ray
1 of 1 Polaroid taken by the Cast and Crew during the filming of GHOSTS
That’s right! The cast and crew of GHOSTS will be armed with Polaroid Cameras throughout the shoot and you will receive a one-off polaroid taken by them. It could be anything from their time behind the scenes or an exclusive to you look at how we achieved the special effects. One unfortunate person will get a cursed polaroid of the face of The Long Lady.
You asked and we delivered. Limited Edition GHOSTS Jumpsuits are now available as part of the higher tiers ... including personalized ones too! 
Now, this one is something special. Either we will include a photo of you in the game itself or you will work with Jed and Visible Games to have your voice featured in the actual game! Yes, you will be one of the callers during a phone-in segment of the show. This is LIVE remember. Perhaps you’ve seen the The Long Lady before, strange memories from your youth that you’ve blocked out until now. Maybe you’re experiencing supernatural manifestations and want to talk to someone about it.  Maybe you’re just low-life prank caller! You will be immortalised in this one of a kind game.
If you want to check what items you will receive in your pledge, we've created this handy matrix for you to check too.
Since Limited Run Games will not be shipping backers their physical copy until 2022. We have decided that shipping costs for physical items will be charged to backers after the campaign has concluded. 
Shipping will be charged after this Kickstarter finishes and this will be based on actual costs incurred to ship and is collected via our pledge manager system. This allows us to charge fairly for all backers and avoid a "one size fits all" mentality to shipping.
At present we have been advised that the shipping to the US and Canada should be around $5 whilst shipping to the RoW will be around $20.
We are working directly with Limited Run Games and will be using their fulfilment centers and partners to ensure that your order ships quickly and the DDP is included so that you can get your physical rewards without any extra hassles!
Because GHOSTS is 99% live action, production needs to begin before we can offer you screenshots or gameplay footage ... and even then we're going to be super careful that we don't want to spoil any of the surprises we have in store for you!
We have carefully calculated our budget so that we can afford the best of the best for this production. We have already heavily invested in creatures being fabricated by the Jim Henson Creature Shop and securing the services of our cast, stunt professionals and visual effects team.
We estimate that 55% of our Kickstarter funds will be put directly towards the production itself which is shaping up to be a huge affair. 35% of our funds will be used to produce the items that are being handled by the fantastic Limited Run Games.
This leaves around 10% which we will use as both a margin of error and for marketing purposes, but we hope you spread the word too!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
First and foremost we absolutely love horror and gaming! However, obviously at the moment we're fully aware and taking as many precautions as we can against Covid-19. All members of the team will be taking regular lateral flow tests supplied by the London Medical Laboratory in order to ensure a safe working environment.

We are also working alongside industry leading stunt coordinators Lucky 13 Action (https://lucky13action.com/) who will ensure that all stunts will be performed in accordance with all regulations.

After the shoot takes place then it's down to editing at the same time as finishing up the engine for the system. We will post updates frequently with regards to our progress. We truly believe GHOSTS will be one of these games to overcome the trying times and become a landmark moment in FMV gaming.

This motivation, above all others, is what drives us.

In terms of timing: we are targeting Feb 2022 for release. However, it does depend on our funding amount. The higher we go, the more hands we can bring "on deck" and get to work quicker. Ultimately, it is far more important to deliver a game that meets the expectations of our fans than to hit a date. We have already built a significant portion of the game, but we do have a lot of work to do.

We have carefully budgeted this project and believe that our funding goal is realistic to provide you with the experience you deserve. Thank you again for the opportunity to make this game happen!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Development Update #1 - New Cast Members & More!
updates.update_content:
Thank you for all of the messages of congratulations for GHOSTS, we're well into development now and wanted to share some exciting news with you...
We are ecstatic to announce that Alice Lowe & Scroobius Pip have joined our video game #GHOSTS! They will play the presenters of the TV show within the game. Welcome to the team Alice and Pip!

What an amazing 30 days this has been! Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, your pledges have made GHOSTS a reality! Work is already well underway on the project, and we will be updating everybody at least once a month going forward with what is happening behind the scenes and we can't wait to share the journey with you.

updates.update_userinfo: GHOSTS fully funded - The Long Lady Lives!
updates.update_content: "Thank you so much for believing in GHOSTS. When I came up with this idea it felt like a pipe dream, one of these fleeting moments of inspiration that disappeared as soon as it arrived. Luckily, when lots of people dream at the same time, you can make that idea a reality. You turn the intangible, tangible. Not only have you made this game a reality but collectively we have summoned The Long Lady. I really can’t wait for you to meet her. So for now, while we can, let’s celebrate! Once again, thank you thank you thank you!" -

"I just wanted to thank everyone for helping us reach the mighty 90% funded mark on kickstarter. It means a lot that you believe in it! This belief will help The Long Lady come to life, whether the world is ready or not! I'm hoping she never has to thank you in person one day..." Jed Shepherd, Writer / Director of GHOSTS

Happy Friday everyone, the response to the cover tease a few days ago was fantastic and we thought we'd make the leap into the weekend even better with a full reveal of the GHOSTS cover artwork designed by the legendary horror artist Graham Humphreys. 
"I put together my dream team of people I respect and admire for GHOSTS. Working with Graham - a horror hero of mine - has been truly wonderful. He has made some of the most iconic artwork in Horror history so its an honour to have him on this project!" - Jed Shepherd, Writer/Director of GHOSTS

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for getting us to £100k, Cover Preview and More!
updates.update_content: “Reaching the £100k milestone is an incredible feeling and I am utterly blown away away by the support GHOSTS has had from the backers and media. We have a lot of hard work left to do on the game and so many exciting things to announce. The great Hideo Kojima once said ‘As a creator, I always want to betray fans' expectations.’ and that's exactly what I'm trying to achieve with GHOSTS. A game that still holds surprises on multiple playthroughs and an experience that you'll never forget.” -

Thank you all for your support of GHOSTS, these past (just under) two weeks has been a wild ride and we've been working feverishly behind the scenes to make our collectors edition even better and also adding some new rewards to the higher tiers too!

This is photo 2 of 3 that was found on a discarded phone on a street in South London.   It is said to contain more evidence of The Long Lady, but again, I am having trouble finding her.   
Can you guys help?

updates.update_userinfo: EVIDENCE OF THE LONG LADY DISCOVERED
updates.update_content: In October 2019, 3 photos were found on a discarded phone in South London. The photos show The Long Lady as she appears on a street for a record 92 seconds. The owner of the phone has not been found.

campaign.story:
EdBoard is a magnetic circuit-building kit made for kids, inspired by real tools used by real engineers. We use stories to make learning super fun and super playful, and we need your help to make it happen!
Add our Cardboard Builders to make awesome creations!
The EdBoard was created with one goal in mind: helping the next generation of engineers find their confidence. Using a combination of story-based learning and large, magnetic components designed for children, the EdBoard represents the cutting edge of at-home STEM learning.
 Created by a passionate group of educators and engineers, our story-based curriculum is designed using the latest in child developmental research. Our approach has been validated by academic research from the University of Colorado Boulder, which showed that the EdBoard limited frustration while helping develop a stronger understanding of circuitry.
Research from the University of Colorado findings (more details in section 5)
EdBoard sparks kids' imaginations by introducing them to the lovable town of Sparkdale. Though a great place to live, the EdBugs who live there need help solving the circuit mysteries and puzzles that are troubling the town. Lizzy the Lightning Bug and her friends will guide young learners through the real-world engineering process of ‘debugging’, designing, and building circuits as they work together to untangle the secrets of Sparkdale.
Following our Kickstarter, we plan to develop and release monthly expansion kits that can be purchased individually or through our subscription service. 
Every kit comes with lesson plans that are carefully crafted to work for children in any learning environment. For educators, we will have free access to additional online guides and lesson plans. At home, new expansion kits ensure new concepts to explore. Your EdBoard will never collect dust on the shelf!


Welcome to the town of Sparkdale, where all the learning takes place! As the newest city engineer of Sparkdale, you and your child will work hand-in-hand with Lizzy the Lightning Bug, using real-world engineering to solve the technical puzzles that have been befuddling the lovable EdBugs. Critters all over the city are wiggling with anticipation to meet their newest engineer! Explore Sparkdale through our circuit stories. Go on an adventure with the EdBugs as they introduce your child to all the awesome applications of circuitry.  
Work through Circuit Stories to help the EdBugs of Sparkdale! As you read through your story, you will encounter and discover the befuddling problems facing the EdBugs. Then, by building circuits on your EdBoard, you will engineer solutions to help the town!
Meet a new EdBug in every circuit story!
Expand Sparkdale and meet new friends in our future expansion kits! Keep an eye out for our upcoming subscription service, which is the easiest way to stay up to date on all the most recent Sparkdale adventures!
The EdBoard is designed so that you don't need any previous circuitry experience to work with your kid. Any parent can easily use the EdBoard!
In our first three kits, your child will learn about...  
There's a lot more than circuitry that children need to succeed in STEM. That's why we use our kits to teach about more than just circuitry. EdBoards help prepare children to succeed in a variety of different academic subjects.
This is only the beginning of Sparkdale and more importantly your child's journey towards becoming an engineer and inventor. Here are just a few examples of the next three year's worth of Circuit Stories we have planned out.   
Work with Lizzie the Lightning Bug to learn the first steps in circuitry. Here you will learn about the basics of electrical flow and the foundations of circuitry. Help the lightning bug engineers install a traffic light in time for Sparkdale’s Festival of Colors!
What’s included:
1 EdBoard
The Main Street Traffic Light Circuit Story
Insertable Story Cards
35 Magnetic Electronic Components Including: LEDs, Wires, Resistors, Power Supply, and Buttons
Assist Maya the Moth in investigating why her hotel is haunted (hint: it isn't!). Learn about inputs and outputs, and be amazed as your circuit begins to move and make noise!
What’s included:
The Haunted Hotel Circuit Story
Insertable Story Cards
25 Additional Magnetic Electronic Components Including: Motor, Phototransistor, Resistors, Wires, LEDs, and Power Supply
 Join Chidi the Cricket on his conservation adventure to the tropical islands off the coast of Sparkdale. Learn not only about digital logic, but also the natural electricity created in thunderstorms.
What’s included:
The Tropical Island Circuit Story
Insertable Story Cards
25 Additional Magnetic Electronic Components Including: Transistors, Capacitors, Resistors, Wires, LEDs, and Power Supply
Let your child’s imagination run wild as they add their own touches to Sparkdale. An opportunity to revisit their past projects and add an awesome new twist: use special magnetic components to build 3D structures with built-in circuits.
What’s included:
The Construction Kit Circuit Story
Insertable Story Cards
30 Additional Magnetic Building Components Including: Ladder Wires, Square Connectors, “L” Wire, Additional Classic Wires, and other special connectors
  Our Construction Kit Expansion has special pieces that help you control the flow of electricity inside of your structures!
As an engineer, there is no better feeling than seeing your designs go from an idea into a real product. With our Cardboard Builders, you get to do exactly that!
Put together your cardboard product and build your circuit inside. Every time you assemble a cardboard builder, you learn a little more about prototyping and different ways to wire your projects. If you like building with your hands, this is the perfect place to start your circuitry journey!
Cardboard Builders are add-ons. All of our tiers with "Creator Kit" in their name come with cardboard builders. 
Add the traffic light Cardboard Builder to the Main Street circuit story, the haunted elevator Cardboard Builder to the Haunted Hotel Circuit Story, and the tropical storm cloud Cardboard Builder to the Tropical Island Circuit Story.
From the ages of 5-11, children are learning about the world around them at an incredible pace. Perhaps more importantly, they are discovering who they are. This is the age at which children are developing their sense of confidence based on their accomplishments. Because of this, frustrating and ineffective learning tools can discourage children from feeling like they can succeed and belong. In the case of electrical engineering, a lack of effective child-friendly tools can prevent children from wanting to enter the electrical engineering field altogether. The EdBoard was created with education theory in mind to encourage young learners to fix this issue.
 EdBoard is backed by research; a study from the University of Colorado that was published in ACM Interaction Design and Children (IDC) 2020 found that children using EdBoards experience less frustration and are able to build circuits four times faster than children using traditional circuitry tools. The study also found that children who are taught how to create a circuit on an EdBoard are able to create the same circuit on industry-standard tools. This means that by using an EdBoard, children learn real-world skills that they can actually apply to a career in electrical engineering.
$50,000 - Online Educational Materials/instructional Videos for teaching at home
$75,000 - Choice of advanced or beginner curriculum
$100,000 - Choose your EdBoard Base Color in our survey following the Kickstarter
$200,000 - We include an additional 5 extra EdBoard connector components that allow you to connect your EdBoard to a Micro:bit or any other alligator clip interface.
At EdBoard, we believe that learning about STEM is fun, not scary. We understand that traditional STEM education can be intimidating. Education through play makes STEM approachable and boosts children’s confidence, comprehension, and retention. Through this, we aim to inspire young learners and make STEM accessible for any child regardless of their background.
At EdBoard, our mission is to create a diverse toolset that inspires future problem solvers. With our Circuit Stories and Cardboard Builders, we hope your children are inspired to confidently build their skillset as they prepare for a lifetime of impactful work in the STEM fields. Our goal is to provide the best STEM tools for teachers, parents, and children.
Our story began in 2017, in a small classroom at CU Boulder, with a group of students brought together by a common goal, increasing the accessibility of world-class STEM education for all children. From that moment to the present day, our team has been driven to realize the dream of the EdBoard: circuit education designed specifically for kids. Refined through countless iterations over the next three years, the EdBoard was perfected by feedback from our most important users: the children themselves. Our philosophy of putting children first was validated in the spring of 2020 when we competed in the New Venture Challenge, where out of 146 other startups EdBoard went on to become one of six finalists. Now, we are pleased to present the result of these efforts: the EdBoard v.1.0, designed specifically to reach children where they are. Fundamentally, our team believes in children: we believe they are intelligent, curious, and eager to learn about their world. Our goal with this product is to not only make that possible but to make it fun. We hope your child loves their EdBoard, and we can’t wait to see what they create!
Website: https://www.edboardtechnologies.com/
Research: https://www.colorado.edu/atlas/edboard-technologies
 You can reach us at: hello@edboardtechnologies.com

campaign.story:
Art by Julianne Griepp
From the creative mind behind Icarus: A Storytelling Game About How Great Civilizations Fall, comes Spenser Starke’s next project Alice is Missing, a silent role-playing game about the disappearance of Alice Briarwood, a high school junior in the small town of Silent Falls. 
Developed by Hunters Entertainment and published & distributed by Renegade Game Studios, Alice Is Missing is a unique kind of roleplaying game in which players only communicate using their phones, sending text messages to each other as they unearth clues about what happened to Alice.
The game is played live and without verbal communication. Players inhabit their character for the entirety of the 90-minute play session, and instead of speaking, send text messages back and forth to the other characters in a group chat, as well as individually, as though they aren’t in the same place together. 
Haunting beautiful, deeply personal, and highly innovative Alice is Missing puts a strong focus on the emotional engagement between players, immersing them in a tense, dramatic mystery that unfolds organically through the text messages they send to one another. Right at home with games like Life Is Strange, Gone Home, Oxenfree, and Firewatch, it’s designed to feel as much like an event-style experience as it does a role-playing game.
Alice Is Missing runs over a single session of 2-3 hours, with 3-5 players. In the first 45 minutes, players create their characters, their relationships to Alice, and their ties with each other. The next 90 minutes are spent uncovering secrets and unearthing clues in an attempt to discover where Alice is, and who is behind her disappearance.
Though text messages seem to be the most common mode of communication in our modern era, they are rarely utilized as a storytelling medium.
The integration of texting into the gameplay unlocks a brand new way to play RPGs that is unlike anything you’ve likely experienced before. It’s personal, immersive, and perfect for remote play.

Powered by simple but unique card mechanics that give everyone equal footing in telling the story, the game runs without a GM, or gamemaster, and instead empowers the players to create the story together.
While in-game time is fluid and the text messages could take place over the course of a day or more, the actual gameplay lasts a total of 90 minutes and is accompanied by a beautifully cinematic, licensed music playlist (featuring artists such as Message To Bears, This Patch of Sky, Justin LaPointe, and Be Still The Earth) which acts as both a timer and a soundtrack for the game.
You’ll start by choosing characters, drawing a motive for how that character acts, and assigning relationships to one another. Then, using the appropriate prompts on your character card, each player will record a secret voicemail to be played at the end of the game.
You’ll then establish some important information about your town of Silent Falls by choosing suspects and locations you think could have played a part in Alice’s disappearance. Lastly, you’ll receive Clue Cards that will be used during the game to generate information about the mystery you’re unraveling.
Once the timer starts and the game begins, you’ll flip your Clue Card when the number on the timer hits the number on the Clue Card’s back. This will often result in you drawing a card from the Suspect or Location deck and combining it with the prompt on the Clue Card to create the information your character uncovers.
This clue is then worked into the text conversation between the characters organically.

These clues will continue to be revealed throughout the game, building tension and heightening the stakes until the 10-minute card flips, and the game comes to its climactic end.
 Once the timer goes off at 90 minutes, players will have the opportunity to send one last text message before the secret voicemails play over the closing music track. Once the voicemails are finished and the current song ends, the game comes to a close. 
By putting its lens on the relationships, tensions, and story arcs between the characters looking for Alice just as much as the search for Alice itself, the game challenges players to explore aspects of emotional intimacy and personal connection in a unique and accessible way.
Alice Is Missing inherently deals with mature themes and potentially-difficult topics such as gender, sexuality, violence, and grief. We’ve been lucky enough to bring on the incredibly talented Lauren McManamon (Girl Underground, Good Society: A Jane Austen RPG, Codex) as our editor to ensure these topics are approached in a thoughtful and responsible manner. 
We’ve also included important tools to help navigate these themes at the table (and off the table) to ensure everyone has both an exhilarating and positive experience.
Though the game has been in development for the last year, in an unintentional way, it mirrors the reality we now face during this era of social distancing; the craving for connection despite the distance that may be between us.
Alice is Missing provides a unique way to play without the traditional hang-ups that come with trying to structure a Virtual Table Top session. Since the only time you'll need to 'go to the table' is to grab a card. The meat of gameplay exists on your mobile devices.
 We’ve put a great deal of work into ensuring Alice Is Missing will be available as a marketplace item on Roll20 not long after the campaign ends. With the lack of in-person gaming opportunities given the current social distancing orders in place around the world, we hope by making the game available in this format quickly, it will allow players to share a unique roleplaying experience together from the comfort and safety of their own home.
The Roll20 version of the game will not replace the use of players’ phones for sending text messages back and forth during the game. It will instead serve as your shared table during online play, allowing everyone to interact with the cards that drive the narrative forward.
 For those of you who would rather not use Roll20, we are offering a PDF with a Print on Demand cards via DTRPG to use with your other messaging systems of choice. It’s important to emphasize, however, that the cards need to be communally accessible individually via a cloud or other software to manage remote play in this way.
We plan to release the digital version of Alice is Missing in July 2020. We plan to release the physical version to our backers in November 2020, with the game being made available to stores soon after through a global publishing deal with Renegade Game Studios. We will use DriveThruRPG for all of our digital fulfillment.
 For this project, we will be charging shipping as we fulfill each item. YOUR PLEDGE DOES NOT INCLUDE THE COST OF SHIPPING. 
We will be using a pledge manager to collect information from backers. 
 We will be using Gamerati for all of our domestic and international fulfillment purposes.
Domestic Shipping: For traditional USPS shipping, we expect to charge ~$8 USD per package through our warehouse for the physical pledge.
International Shipping: We will be working with our fulfillment partner for available countries in order to ship via local shipping options. 
We expect the cost of shipping for the physical package to be as follows: 
Australia and New Zealand: ~$8 USD
Canada and the European Union: ~$12 USD 
Europe (Non-EU): ~$19 USD
Rest of the world ~$25 USD
NOTE: The final cost of shipping may differ from our estimations.

PLAY

 Audio Fusion’s Performer App:
Is a pro-level wireless in-ear monitoring system for ANYone with a smartphone
  Is a fraction of the cost of professional wireless, and personal mixing
 systems
Gives you the ultimate: hear AND control your mix 
Try a free demo of the iOs version of Performer here: Try the App
The Performer app is a complete monitor mixer, giving you total control over the sound in your ears. Adjust the volume, panning, and labeling of each channel to create your own personalized mix.
Performer receives its audio from our SoundCaster app, which runs on Mac.
SoundCaster connects to your audio input device and broadcasts each channel in real-time over Wi-Fi to each connected Performer. Performer will receive audio-only from the SoundCaster software.
Performer and SoundCaster work in conjunction with a third app for iPad called Director. It can be used by the sound technician or monitor engineer to hear and control the mix each musician has on their Performer. Director gives you simultaneous control over each musician's mix to help with troubleshooting and fine-tuning. With it, you can also edit the instrument labels and remotely control the audio settings on SoundCaster.
1. It all starts with SoundCaster software which runs on your laptop.                    
2. Connect your instruments to the digital audio source such as the soundboard at a venue, connect your laptop to the digital audio source.                     
3. Connect your laptop to a dedicated Wi-Fi router                     
4. Connect their earphones and tap the Performer icon on their phones or tablets to start the app.
The Performer App will automatically find the rest of the system and download all of the labeling and all the information that they might need for each of the instrument channels. You literally just plug in your earphones, start the app and start listening right away.
Audio Fusion Systems is a software startup based in Austin, TX founded by Brandon Leafblad (left) and Kevin Slick (right).
Kevin is a super genius with a long career as a software engineering manager for companies like Dell and AMD. He built software for networked products and saw an opportunity to create a standard networking protocol to turn smartphones and tablets into powerful devices for musicians to use in live performance. It turns out that delivering real-time audio over Wi-Fi was a really hard problem to solve but Kevin has done it. He has four patents and one more pending on this technology that is going to revolutionize the way musicians do live performance.
Brandon is no Justin Timberlake (but let's not tell him that), but he spent a minute as the front-man of a cover band and has spent countless hours on stage as a volunteer worship leader at his church. He has an MBA from the University of Texas and more than 25 years of experience in general management, sales, and customer service. He cares deeply about helping aspiring musicians sound their best and loves giving churches and bands affordable tools to take control of their performance.    
The great part is that we already have the system available for iOS, the challenge is creating and testing it for the most popular Android devices. The Connections that you purchase in the campaign can be used by any iOS or Android user. Here’s what the timeline will look like.

campaign.story:
Murders By Mail is excited to bring Sherlock Holmes directly to your mailbox, in a new interactive murder-mystery featuring the greatest detective in the world!
 London, 1893.
A prominent paleontologist has been murdered, struck down by a fossilized dinosaur bone. A group of naturalists, gathered to hear the victim speak, provide an abundance of witnesses and potential suspects. The Royal Society is in an uproar and Scotland Yard is at a loss. Only the great consulting detective–Sherlock Holmes–can unravel this mystery.
Backers will become the first daring investigators to venture back to Victorian London and attempt to bring the killer to justice! The new case features:
An 18x24 map of 1893 London
  A 36-page city directory with over 500 residential and business locations
  A special edition of The Illustrated Police News, a Victorian tabloid featuring reporting on the scandalous murder
  A brochure and map for Burlington House, headquarters of The Royal Society (and scene of the crime!)
  Details on Sherlock Holmes’ hand-picked assistants and informants
  …and more!
 With Murders By Mail, you don't just read mysteries: you solve them! Part board game, part puzzle, part role-playing game, Murders By Mail is a new type of murder mystery game. Play alone or with friends–great for couples and families looking for a non-TV-based activity! All you need to play is a mailbox and a cellphone.
Gameplay is simple:
A box will arrive in the mail containing your case file. This includes a description of the crime, introductions to your investigators, plus maps, photographs, clues, and other important pieces of reference. The investigation begins here!
  Decide where you want to investigate–which leads to follow, which suspects to interrogate, which locations to visit. Each investigator has special talents, so choose wisely! When you’re ready, use your phone to send each investigator to their target.
  In a few days, a letter will arrive from your team describing what each of them have learned. New information, clues and suspects will be revealed, but remember... the killer is watching, and will do anything to avoid being caught.
  Return to the case file, review your notes, and send the team back out to new destinations. Repeat until you’re ready to solve the case!
To learn more, please visit our website.
Best of all, you can play at your own pace, taking as much or as little time between moves as you need. Cases tend to last somewhere between 8-10 moves over the course of 8-12 weeks, but everyone's game experience is unique.
Ultimately it's all up to your wits, attention to detail and deductive reasoning!
 This is a relatively simple project, without a lot of stretch goals or added features to pile on. We know exactly what's required to produce and deliver on this new case.
However, as a special offer for Kickstarter backers, we’re offering additional pledge rewards to add one or both of our two existing cases at a discounted price. They are: The Case of the Blinded Birder, an English Cozy mystery, and The Bloom of Hollywood, a noir mystery set in post-war Los Angeles.
We'll give you the option to have any added cases ship right away, or have them delivered alongside The Fellowship of Bones.
So what are you waiting for? There are murders to solve!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With a successful Kickstarter under our belt and nearly two hundred cases delivered, we've encountered only a few surprises along the way, and learned a great deal. We're confident that we know exactly how to complete and deliver this project to you.

The biggest challenge we face will be unpredictable delays and hurdles due to the current COVID-19 pandemic. This will primarily affect delivery schedules from third-party print/production vendors used to make certain case materials, such as oversize maps and shipping boxes. At the time of launch, our preferred vendors are still operational, but should they encounter problems or major delays, we will make every effort to find suitable alternate vendors, and keep our backers well-informed of progress along the way.

updates.update_content:
There's not a whole lot to mention in this update, except...
shipping has begun!
The USPS just drove away with the first flight of The Fellowship of Bones reward packages, with the second and third flights departing in the next few days. We expect boxes will start to arrive this Friday/Saturday and on into next week, with all shipments delivered by June 12.

Thank you!
We're thrilled to be able to deliver The Fellowship of Bones to you, our backers! Thank you all sincerely for your generosity and support. Now that the project is finalized, here's a short update to let everyone know what's happening now and what happens next.
Processing
Behind the scenes, Kickstarter is processing and collecting everyone's pledges, and will deliver the funds to us two weeks after project end, so on or around Memorial Day. Additionally, we'll be sending out surveys to each of you, by backer level, to collect addresses, phone numbers and emails in preparation for shipping (and for playing the game!) - please check your spam/junk folders if you don't see the survey in the next day or so.

As the project winds down (and nears 300% funded - amazing!), we wanted to share one more in-depth look at another investigator who'll you'll use to aid Sherlock in solving The Fellowship of Bones.
Investigator Profile: Mrs. Hudson
As we mentioned in our previous update, we wanted to stick with canon characters for Sherlock Holmes’ investigators. But why Holmes's long-suffering landlady, ? In large part because we love her so much. Not only as portrayed by Una Stubbs in the BBC’s , but also in other movies, TV shows, and in Doyle’s stories. She is a sensible and loving presence in Sherlock’s life, something of a grounding influence. She’s been a favorite character of ours since we first read a Sherlock Holmes story, and it seemed to us to be well past time for her to get more of the spotlight.

Our little project is into the back third of its funding timeline, and we're just thrilled to see it pushing past 200% (and even higher). Thank you all again so very much.
As we near completion of the project, we're finalizing many components and designs for printed materials. Many/most of these are nearly finished by the time we move to playtesting, but there's always some design cleanup and improvements to be made as we get things ready to send to printers.

Wow.
We've hit our funding goal in just four days. Thank you all so much for your interest and support, we're beyond thrilled to have hit the mark already. Our previous project successfully funded with about four days remaining, and while it was terribly exciting when it happened, the anticipation was, well... murderous. Funding on this end of the timeline is much less stressful.

"After seeing the demo at SPIEL, Divinity Original Sin the Board Game immediately became one of my most anticipated titles for 2020!"
                                                                                                                             --Aldie from BoardGameGeek
"It feels JUST like the video game. ESPECIALLY the combat, which balances perfectly on the all too familiar razor edge of 'we got this!' and 'we’re all gonna die!' "                                                                                                                                                --Jesse Cox
"Plays brilliantly, and eerily like the videogame we know and love."                  --PCGamesN 
"I was impressed that this was a unique take that captures the exploration and narrative strengths of the video game version without feeling like every other game on Kickstarter"                                       --CNET
Divinity Original Sin: The Board Game is an epic adventure game set in the world of Rivellon. Up to 4 players take their heroes on a branching, narrative adventure, filled with tactical combat and meaningful choices. Thanks to the Chronicle System, the choices you make will impact not just your own story, but the future of the Divinity Original Sin universe. Based on the award-winning Divinity Original Sin II video game by Larian Studios, the board game developed by Lynnvander Studios expands Divinity in new directions, adding new stories, side quests, skills, items, and monsters, all in a brand new tabletop experience.  
 With all of the stretch goals we've unlocked so far, there's a ton of content!
Extended Edition Pledge (render, not all miniatures shown) - click for full size
Extended Edition now contains (including stretch goals): 
3 story books, 1596 cards (all 63x88mm), 47 miniatures, 342 tokens, 32 dice, 20 metal coins, 2 leather bags.
Premium Edition now contains (including stretch goals): 
1 story book, 1391 cards (all 63x88mm), 45 miniatures, 342 tokens, 32 dice, 20 metal coins, 2 leather bags.
Standard Edition now contains (including stretch goals): 
1 story book, 1391 cards (all 63x88mm), 37 miniatures, 342 tokens, 16 dice, 2 cloth bags.

The Broken Token entered the tabletop gaming market in 2013 with a successful Kickstarter campaign aimed at providing an organization solution for card games. Today, The Broken Token is a leader in the gaming accessories and upgrades niche, with a large and varied product line built on the foundation of designing and manufacturing custom, laser-cut, in-box game organizers, made in the USA. 
                                               *               *                *               *
Norse Foundry looks to provide quality products such as Role playing Game Dice, Game Mats to shield your table from any damage, and the finest of dwarven currency to carry everywhere you go. We strive to create the best game-playing experience possible by offering you a wide variety of top-of-the-line pieces and equipment to play with, all at prices that won’t break the bank.  
                                               *               *                *               *
The Vallejo Company was established in 1965, in New Jersey, U.S.A. In the first years the company specialized in the manufacture of Film Color, waterbased acrylic colors for animated films (cartoons). At present Acrylicos Vallejo exports to more than 55 countries, and the AV colors comply with all the security and environment regulations in force in the European Common Market and the United States.
"I got to demo Divinity Original Sin the Board Game at Boardgamegeek Convention, and I can say with confidence, this game is GOOD! I love the combinations of characters, abilities and locations. Lots of replay-ability. Over 900 cards!!! Also, the Chronicle System is so cool. The game features great strategy, while keeping the humour and rich world of the video game." -- Daryl Andrews, Game Designer
Read from the story book and decide as a team where to go and how to respond to the world around you. Depending on the characters’ traits and abilities, you might have unique options available to you during the sections. Pet Pal, anyone? 
Story choices direct you to explore locations. You place a unique set of cards around the game board. Every member of the party must choose which area to visit. Both the story and the artwork for the locations may discover clues of what to expect. Each player picks up their location card. Some reward your curiosity by rewarding with new treasure or recipe ingredients. Then again, some locations will have traps or lead into combat. 
Combat plays out over a number of rounds where players and monsters take turns acquiring action points (AP) and use them to move around, use items, and perform skills. Players use the skills they acquire throughout the game to perform unique and powerful attacks, some with additional elemental effects. Most skills require some cooldown time before they can be used again, so choosing which skills to use when is of critical importance.  
The iconic elemental interactions of Divinity Original Sin are here! Make a monster wet, so another player can hit it with ice to freeze it solid and keep it from acting. Or maybe your ally hits the enemy with lightning to make it stunned! Creating combinations is a must to ensure victory against the most challenging of enemies. Watch out though, because enemies can create combinations as well.  
The choices you make affect how the story unfolds during the campaign toward one of many possible endings. Certain paths, locations (and boss fights!) will only be available if your group makes certain choices. 
However, this is a Chronicle System board game, meaning your choices will also impact the direction of future Divinity board games. Each copy of the game has a unique one-use code enabling you to submit the choices you made during your adventure to the developers at Lynnvander Studios.
We will collect that information and use it to decide what happens in the next expansion for the game. Perhaps that merchant family has grown to be part of the nobility, and they will remember you saved them. If most players chose that course of action, the expansion will have some very appreciative nobles in it. Then again, if players took the other path, perhaps one of the merchant's descendants survived and seeks vengeance. With the Chronicle System, you not only change the course of your game, but also impact the future of Rivellon as a whole!
The submission code is a one-time use, but the game’s campaign is not. Nothing in the game is destructible, and the branching nature of the story means players can play multiple times to explore avenues they didn’t originally see based on their choices. A single playthrough of the campaign might only uncover 25% of the game’s content.

Kickstarter is an excellent way to help us understand market demand. Since we're primarily a video game production studio, we are constantly looking for new and innovative ways to bring you more of our world. We will invest everything we receive on Kickstarter into refining the board game experience we'll offer you. By backing now, you’ll be adding to the fun you’ll have when the game is manufactured and delivered.
Of course we'll keep you posted via regular updates about the game’s development and we honestly can't wait to get this game in your hands!
In 1996, in a small office in Ghent, Belgium, Larian Studios was born. Since then, our passion to create a world class video games has driven the Divinity series - six games that straddle multiple genres and defy expectations. Our first crowdfunded success, Divinity: Original Sin, won over 150 awards and nominations, and the recently-released sequel Divinity: Original Sin 2 launched with a 93 Meta-critic rating, as well as over 160 awards (Including the BAFTA for Best Multiplayer Game) and counting!
Thanks to the success of these two games, our family has grown to over 200 people around the world, working in our Ghent, St Petersburg, Quebec and Dublin studios. Our next game, Baldur’s Gate 3, was recently announced at E3 2019.
                                             *               *                *               *
Lynnvander Studios Inc. is a Canadian based company enhancing existing and developing new creative properties for clients worldwide. Founded in 2015 by Thomas M Gofton and Josh Derksen, Lynnvander is responsible for “The Chronicle System” as well as projects in board game design including Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Angel, Evil Dead 2, Cowboy Bebop: Board Game Boogie, Dragon Ball Z: The Board Game Saga, Star Trek Attack Wing: The Alliance System, Terminator Genisys: Rise of the Resistance, Super Camelot, Shadowrun Sprawl Ops, Reanimator, Red Sonja, Captain Canuck and their own Legacy Line. They are currently designing games for some of the most remarkable intellectual properties in the world including Mega Man, Army of Darkness, Naruto Shippuden, and My Hero Academia. Lynnvander works with countless publishers around the world including Funko, Wizkids, IDW, Topps Entertainment, River Horse Entertainment, Jasco Games, Catalyst Game Labs, Norse Foundry Publishing, Japanime Games and Dynamite Entertainment.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We're already funding the board game ourselves and are coming to Kickstarter with the aim of expanding the game's content as well as engaging with community input. The biggest risks are that this is our first board game. We've mitigated this by working with veterans at Lynnvander Studios. We're working diligently to ensure all the pitfalls and roadblocks of manufacturing a physical product of this scale is minimized and clean, however, we only want the best possible product for you and factors such as delay's in molding and tooling, print errors and shipping delays are all something normal in the board game industry. 

If that happens, it'll be because we hit a real roadblock or because some other factor out of our control ended up taking significantly more time and resources than we expected. Those kinds of things happen, but they shouldn't affect our ability to finish and release an innovative board game that'll be a whole world of fun.

updates.update_content:
Hello friends! How’ve you been?
Here in Larian’s board game laboratories we’ve been hard at work and over the last few months Divinity: Original Sin the Board Game has made meaningful progress. We’ve completely overhauled our artwork and miniature designs, upgraded all of our UI, and have conducted three in-depth playtests to evaluate the state of the game in full. But – probably unsurprisingly – developing a board game about shared adventures (that requires a lot of being together) in the middle of a worldwide pandemic has its challenges, to say the least.

updates.update_userinfo: Update 26: The Ash Of Their Past, The Ember Of Adventure
updates.update_content:
Hello and welcome to Kickstarter Update 26!
Our main focus today is on the Origin Stories. There’s a huge amount for us to delve into there, including a chat with the stories’ lead writer, Dylan ‘Tavern Tale Teller’ Birtolo himself. He talks us through the development of the Origin Stories, the vast and fantastic changes that have occurred between iterations for Playtest 3, the mechanical shifts, and the compelling reasons behind those major improvements.

updates.update_userinfo: Update 25: Changes Detectable, Miniatures Impeccable, Let's Take A Look At Statuses Effectable
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Welcome to Kickstarter Update Number 25!
With Playtest 3 coming up soon, we want to guarantee that every single strand of the game is examined and tested by our playtesters. In other words, we want Playtest 3 to be content complete, including the fully designed Rulebook, refined gameplay systems like Status Effects, the dread-inducing Nightmare Mode, the personal goals of the Origin Stories and as much artwork as we can deliver. Owing to this, we’ve widened the window of development between Playtest 2 and 3 to accommodate it all. Assuming all goes well, no big changes will be made for Playtest 4 which will then be the final testing stage before the game goes to print later this year.

Hello Everyone!
Welcome to Kickstarter Update 23!
This month we’re going to be casting a closer eye on all the beautiful new artwork that's been rolling out over the last few months, as well as diving deeper into the skill school changes we made for Playtest Round 2. Check out the month’s Update Video where Kieron walks us through all that good stuff and more....

updates.update_userinfo: Update 22: Forged in the Fires of Mount Playtest
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, and welcome to Kickstarter update number 22!
Today we delve deep into the furnace of playtesting. Very much like blacksmithing, the ore of initial ideas needs to be smelted, shaped into ingots of better design, and forged into something spectacular!
Each successive round of the playtesting process will involve the addition of new and innovative materials. These additions will arise from suggestions made by the previous round of playtests. Playtest Round Two is kicking off soon, and there’s an abundance of gameplay changes for those groups to sink their teeth into!

updates.update_content:
Hello and welcome to Kickstarter update number 21!
In this update, we’ll discuss sample molds, playtest progress, artwork, and the blood-chilling bosses you could face off against during your adventure. Here’s Kieron to guide you through the latest developments:

updates.update_userinfo: Update 20: Crafting Expands, Runes are at Hand, We’re sending Playtests far across the Land
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
Welcome to Kickstarter update number 20!
It's just over a month since our last update, The Road Ahead. In that update we discussed the need for a delay on the game’s release, with the new release date being set for Summer 2021. Thank you, for understanding our desire to take the extra time to iterate and make greater improvements to the game.

Hello everyone!

During these past two months we've been assessing the development of Divinity: Original Sin - The Board Game. Our ambition has always been to produce something that'll be a top tier gaming experience across the board. Narratively, mechanically and visually, we set the bar high because you deserve it.
We've had many discussions, and many iterations since the end of the successful Kickstarter campaign. Ultimately, we've chosen to delay the game until Summer 2021 to allow for more iteration as well as massive improvements to the quality of the game and its art. We know this may come as a disappointment, but we think it’s necessary in order for us to bring you a game of superior quality that meets and hopefully exceeds all your expectations.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,
Welcome to Kickstarter update number 18!
We wanted to begin this update by addressing how development and production will be affected by the current COVID-19 pandemic. The good news is that China is getting back on track, which means we don't foresee any problems with our supply and production chain. The first element  that goes into production are the miniatures, which are nearly all approved, so STL files will be sent to our Chinese partners soon. The bad news is that the blind playtesting groups we had planned will need to be delayed due to the fact that the schools, universities, and overseas travel participants cannot make it because each of these things are effectively shut down.

campaign.story:
Randy's Camera will be launching on the following platforms:
Steam (Windows).
Mobile (Android).
DRM Free (Itch.io and Gamejolt).
The game also can be released for iPhone, Mac and Linux if the stretch goal is reached.
A Switch port will be possible if we can reach the $20,000 stretch goal in order to have the funds to find a publisher and make the respective port.
Randy's Camera is a game in which you use a camera to interact with the different elements of your environment to solve multiple kind of puzzles. 
The idea of the game is to make players feel the same as a photographer trying to take the perfect photo. Every time a photo is taken, the camera’s battery drains by a little, so players need to think very carefully about their next movement in order to make their way through the multiple levels. 
During the levels you will be able to find multiple collectibles, NPCs and maybe some secrets or easter eggs.
You can experience some of the gameplay by yourself by playing the demo.
Randy is an enthusiastic photographer who wants to show everyone that he is ready to become a professional. In order to do that, he gets involved in a journey through Bokehland to find the Golden Camera, a sacred camera, which according to what his grandfather told him, could turn anyone into a true professional photographer.
The story of the game is going to be presented through some small cutscenes illustrated by Gaby Yoyo (my girlfriend), who is a very talented artist and is currently helping me doing some promotional art for the game.
I had the idea to make Randy's camera many years ago, but I never had the opportunity to dedicate the time and effort necessary to finish it. Initially, it was going to be a project for college and it was basically a 2D photography simulator, it was very complex and also very boring for anyone who did not know about photography, so I adapted it to create a videogame that still had the essence of feeling like a photographer and also be fun for everyone.
Currently the development of the game is like 35% done, all the core systems are in place (movement, photography mechanics, dialogs, menus, overworld) and the game is already localized in English and Spanish languages.
These are some of the things left to do:
Improve and polish the existing game visuals.
Create the graphics and layouts of various of the levels.
Add additional mechanics (like the capacity to undo some moves).
Illustrate cutscenes.
API implementation of the different platforms (achievements, cloud saving).
Make the Level Editor (if the stretch goal is reached).
More music.
Develop the iPhone, Mac and Linux port (if the stretch goal is reached).
A lot of testing.
The planned release date for the game is Q2 2020. I'm very confident that I can deliver an awesome and polished game for that date with the required funds. 
Important note: If the Switch port goal is reached, it will be launched some time after the initial release.
I always wanted to make a game about photography because I love photography and video games since childhood, but that is not the only reason why I'm making this game.
I'm from Venezuela, and due to the political and financial situation of the country, I was forced to move to another place: Spain. This has been a hard journey, I left my family,  girlfriend and friends back in order to find some financial stability in another country to be able to help them. I have not managed to get a stable job, so I decided to invest some of my free time during the past 7 months in this project hoping to find some financial support to continue doing this game full time and be able to develop more games in the future.
I'm putting all my heart and soul into this game because for me is not only a game, is the start of a new future for me, my family and my girlfriend. I love to make games since I was a little boy, so in addition to helping my family, this could also be an opportunity to fulfill my dream of becoming a game developer.
 DIGITAL COPY OF THE GAME
Once the game is completed, you'll get a copy of the full game in the platform of your desire.
BECOME A NPC IN THE GAME
Be in the game as a NPC. You can also have a custom message of your liking. (It needs to be previously approved by me).
DIGITAL ILLUSTRATION OF YOU WITH RANDY 
A custom digital portrait illustration of YOU with Randy made by Gaby Yoyo.
BECOME A PLAYABLE CHARACTER IN THE GAME
Play as yourself in the game and help Randy in his journey through Bokehland!
 Me and Gaby Yoyo as we appear in the game.
 40% of the amount of the campaign goes toward paying bills, food and basic expenses to be able to dedicate myself full time on the project in order to deliver the game in the expected time.
 31% goes to taxes: 5% to Kickstarter, another 5% to Amazon Payments and 21% to Spanish taxes.
 15% is dedicated to paid all the publishing fees and legal procedures that I need to go through in order to publish the game.
 10% for paying a music composer to make more music for the game.
 4% to cover the time I need to invest in the rewards.
As I said before, I'm a graphic designer, so I can do all the graphics of the game by myself. Also, my girlfriend is helping me with some illustrations required for diverse things. The sounds are either recorded by myself or made upon paid sound packs from different online stores.
Social Networks
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risk of a puzzle game is that the puzzles may lack some logic or become boring, so I will be doing my best to deliver a fun and challenging game.

Making a videogame is a difficult and complex task (I know it firsthand) and this is my first commercial game, so I may underestimate the time and budget this process will take and this could cause a delay of the release date of the game.

I'm going to be posting updates on my social networks to keep every backer informed about the progress of the project.

Huge Thanks to our Amazing Backers and Supporters!!  We are FULLY FUNDED! 
Sphero Mini, Wowwee MiP, Sphero Bolt
Kinazium is a construction set for creating mazes and games for robots!  
Kinazium unleashes the potential of robots by giving kids the tools to design mazes, games and more for playing, racing and competing. At home or in school Kinazium engages kids for hours.   
Invent and design mazes and games like this:  
Each Kinazium includes:
 4 Interconnecting Mats: each 20 x 20 inches, creating a 160 Sq. in. surface 
 44 Mixed Sized Flexible Surfaces: for walls, jumps, teeter-totters, hoops and more
 80 Pegs: Multi-functional connectors of mats, surfaces, and sensors
 2 Sensors: Wireless accelerometer sensors complete the game by adding timers, point scoring, or robot interaction
1 Carry-Along Storage Bag

Robotic School Programs love Kinazium!
Kinazium adds three dimensional challenges for robots that engage physics concepts into  curriculums. It can be used everyday, engaging kids to invent and create and collaborate. Easy to clean up and put away, and less tape on the floor. Infinitely expandable, a four pack can be used individually or combined to become Kinazium in the Gymnasium!  
Kinazium out and about at schools.
Kinazium is mazes, obstacles, racetracks and more   
 Design and Build                          Place Sensors                             Play & Compete!
How it works:
Kids design a maze, towers or games like skee-ball, sports games, anything they can imagine. They add in the sensors to complete the game - the sensors can be set to score points, subtract points, be timers or to interact with the robots.  
Then the racing, or gamesmanship begins!   
Kinazium kits link together making it infinitely expandable. An 'evergreen' toy, it has long engagement playability because every time it comes out of the bag, new games and mazes are invented. We'll create add-on kits to continue to expand the universe of possibilities.
Kids get right on the floor and intuitively start building. Parents and Teachers love that kids are inventing and designing, using their hands and working together to create complex challenges for their robots.

Your Robot is waiting for Kinazium!   
No Robot? No Worries! Check out our Robot Packages! 
Kinazium is for Kids, Parents and STEM Educators
Combine left and right-brain learning for an amazing playing experience. Benefits include:
Educators love Kinazium because it brings new opportunity to their Robotics programs    
Comments coming in from other teachers:
Jean Hendrickson – I need to keep an eye of this one. It is going to be a classroom game changer.
Jami Sheilds - I want this so bad for my class of coders!
Kim Jackson Backer - These are awesome #teacherwishlist
Debbie Guerin Kryspin – Have a classroom full of Sphero Bolts and minis - REALLY need this!
Kinazium is ready for prime-time  
The Team Behind Kinazium 
Kinazium was invented by Taylor Scott, Hunter Reid, Emily Scott, Susan Crouse and Adam Kemp.  Their expertise in engineering and product development varies from successful startups to technical products for large companies; some products even earned technical Emmys.  
Want to Hear More? 
Click here to listen to the BoulderTech Podcast Interview with Susan Crouse CEO, or the STEM Everyday podcast by Chris Woods.
 What's Next? 
Build Kinazium and Augmented Reality Games
Kinazium and Augmented Reality
Some robots give you the ability to develop your own games. With open source tools for creating Augmented Reality it's not a big a leap to create games with virtual opponents in your physical kinazium game! In this example we took a 3D animated character, attached her to the target and programed her to disappear if the target disappears, which happens when the robot rolls over the target. Knock out characters and Score! You decide the characters, you make the rules, you determine the scoring. You (and your students) are the creator of amazing robot games!
 We've Journeyed from Rapid Prototyping to Fully Tested and Ready to Manufacture 
Kinazium has been extensively tested at home, in schools and at events, tuning the product until it is exactly right.  We've selected child safe materials with characteristics that unleash the imagination in kids.  We've designed the pegs to fit the hands of kids and adults.  We've set our supply chains in motion and have received samples for production. Traxart Toys is ready to launch Kinazium!  Join us on this exciting journey.

Hi All,
It's hard to believe how much the world has changed since January. YOU, our great kickstarter backers helped get us rolling. We have been  working to get distributors to share Kinazium with more schools and school districts. But as the pandemic hit the brakes as it rolled around the world, schools bravely shifted to on-line teaching. Now we are all doing our best to transform our lives and keep Coronavirus in check.

Hi Amazing Backers,
Most of you probably received our Inaugural Kinazium Newsletter, but just in case you missed it, you can see it here:  https://mailchi.mp/6fca9503bb83/kinazium-creations-inaugural-issue-6357705
Two important takeaways:

Kinazium headed out yesterday to all the wonderful kickstarter supporters! Thanks and enjoy! More news to follow soon, in the meantime have a wonderful Holiday Season. Susan, Taylor, Emily, Adam and Hunter

Today was the day our Kinazium shipment was to be waiting on a dock in Denver, so we headed out early to load it up. So excited to get to this huge milestone. Hi Awesome Backers!  
Everything continues to move along the manufacturing pipeline. The final parts are going to our packaging house next week, and then we will be moving to the next stage of shipping. We are also in the midst of product safety testing. We visited Soaring Heights K-8 last week to have some students test the pegs and walls and I gave a talk about inventing. We made the fit a little tighter for putting pegs in holes, but the snap-fit for swiveling is great for making ramps, gates and teeter totters.
We're so thrilled to see Kinazium parts emerging from the factories in China. Check out the pictures! Walls and Sensors coming along too.

Hi Kinazium Enthusiasts,
We are so grateful you have joined us in the journey to bring Kinazium to market. Since the end of the Kickstarter we have been working hard to ensure we meet the deadline to deliver Kinazium this fall. We are setting up manufacturing, testing final samples, and very close to manufacturing parts. Things are moving along nicely to plan. Check out how far we've come from our early design.
