Get the best of both worlds! The immersive, fun factor of a mobile game with the social and interactive aspect of a boardgame will make you fall in love with Publish or Perish - a true hybrid game that clashes fun and science!
This Augmented Reality deduction board game for 1 to 5 players is the perfect tool for getting your kids into physics!
Publish or Perish is a cooperative family game where everyone is a winner. Play as a team of scientists and try to beat the game together. Spend time with your family discovering new, secret properties of particles!
All set and ready to experiment!
To discover the secret property of each particle, the science team will have to show a full spectrum of skills and abilities that a true scientist has: deduction, risk management, insight, cooperation, keeping track of incoming information and communication. Does that sound too hard for your children? Don’t worry, for the game is extremely easy to handle and narrows down to a straightforward deduction game enhanced by the fun and colorful application!
Barry Doublet from the Dice Tower and his daughter Charlotte review the game! :D
This game is not about being a Super Hero or saving the world. The goal is to win the Nobel Prize! Science is important for the future of our children, discovering the secrets of the most basic components of physics may be the key to the understanding the universe :)
Every scientist will take turns to use the mobile device which will be transformed into a Particle Collider! How cool is that? By picking two particles from different groups and clashing them against each other, you will discover their secret properties. The result of the experiment can be noted down in the research notebook and compared to the other experiments the team has performed, to deduct the value you are looking for! Next, you can publish your discoveries to score points and reach the ultimate goal of winning the Nobel Prize and therefore Winning the Game!
While playing this game you don’t only practice the scientific method but you also learn about real sub-atomic particles! Electrons, Protons, Neutrons… All of them generate points in accordance to their rarity! From time to time players will be thrilled to stumble across super rare particles such as the elusive Higgs Boson or the theoretical Graviton! Finding their secret property can push the research lightyears ahead of our time!
The app takes on the role of the “Keeper of Secrets”, plays animations and sounds, shows the results of the experiments and publications, randomizes events and provides a great immersive experience. The particles will have different properties assigned to them every game to assure no two games are ever the same!
Augmented Reality in Action!
More Augmented Reality! :D
About the mobile device:
"Why do kids need a mobile device to play this game? Don't they spend enough time in front of the screen already? I don't even want mobile devices in my board games..." All of those are valid points, however kids will disagree with you. They see the world from the totally opposite perspective and that's why this game is the perfect middle ground for joining together different generations.
If the fact that kids love this game doesn't convince you can replace the app and change the game at will! The game has been designed to provide you no limitations, only fun! We believe that families should have a great time without the technology too!
Please read the FAQ at the end of the page if you have questions about the app!
Getting kids to learn anything can be hard sometimes. That's why games are fantastic way of sneakily teaching kids anything! Here is what you can expect to learn from the game:
Scientific method: making experiments, noting down the results and repeating the process all over again is the best way of learning this skill!
Physics: most of the known sub-atomic particles are in the game. You will learn that Electrons have a negative charge and that a Proton is actually made up of Quarks!
Cooperation over Competition: because we can achieve much more if we work together. Collaboration and teamwork is a great skill to have!
Math: you heard right! You or your kid will be solving deductive problems similar to simple equations!
Time Management: in Publish or Perish the clock is always ticking! Planning the moves you have left is the key of mastering the game.
Science is Fun: it's very important to not be afraid of the "scary" subjects in school. If you love science as much as we do, give your kid a reason to fall in love with it as well.
I am really happy you made it this far reading through the text. I would like to share my story with you. My name is Marcin, and this is how this project came about.
The truth is my son had never been interested in physics or maths or other scientific subjects. He was passionate about playing games on my smartphone, despite me and my wife’s best intentions.
Having always had a keen interest in physics I decided I would make a game that would interest him. I got in touch with some professionals in the field to make sure that the game would be scientifically accurate. I got together with some friends and started developing. My team came up with a physics based hybrid board game for the whole family called Publish or Perish.
I designed this game with the idea of the "Publish or Perish" in mind where only the best scientists survive. The competitive rules of the game dictated that players should play against each other to see who could publish some research first. I thought this was a great idea until the first testing session with kids came along. The children automatically started cooperating with each other, showing each other what they had found and deduced! We previously designed our cards so that they could be hidden with ease. Imagine my surprise when I found them face up on the table, being shared along with the results of the experiments.
After repeated testing the fact seemed indisputable. The game changed and became the cooperative game you can see. This turned out to be a big life lesson for me of how while trying to educate our children, they may end up educating us.
Rewards Explained:

This book will help you fill up on your trivia about Quantum Physics and hopefully help you answer a question or two.
Personalized thank you email: because we love you so much, to show our gratitude we will send you a personalized email as soon as the campaign is over. Expect a small surprise inside ;)

T-Shirt: feel awesome with the Publish or Perish T-Shirt! Super funny and high quality material clothes with two versions. One for kids and another for adults. Ideal for fans of the game and real scientists, who know the push for publishing. :D (Preview soon) (Preview soon)
The game: all the basic components and stretch goals will be included in every game. 70 cards, 2 boards, 1 research notebook, 3 pawns and the rules manual. This also includes the mobile app which you can download for free.

CERN Visit: this is THE treat for you and your favorite little scientist. We will visit the biggest Large Hadron Collider in the world! We will take care of everything, so you’re just free to enjoy one of the best days of your life. The prize is individual so if you want to bring the family with you, you just need to add an extra $999 to your pledge per family member (Transport to Geneva is unfortunately outside our reach :( )
Rombo Games is the company behind Publish or Perish. It was created to bring this and many more amazing next generation family board games to life! We are an independent studio, committed utterly to create new interactive experiences in approachable, easy to learn board games that will be able to join generations to have tons of fun together.
Wow! You made it all the way here! In case you don't know, you are the best! If you would want to support us even further, please like and share our social media pages... it's a minute for you but we will be eternally grateful!

PLEASE HELP US REACH $60,000 SO WE CAN DONATE 1,000 BOOKS TO CHILDREN IN NEED OUR STORY Nearly two years ago, we were invited to a baby celebration for a dear friend, Matt. Amie & Matt have worked closely together, creating dozens of websites over the years, and he has become part of our chosen family. We knew exactly what we wanted to get a developer like Matt—a cool kid’s book about code, a book that would introduce Matt's baby to the nerdy world of websites, apps, and digital products. We were shocked to find that none existed... so, we wrote our own kid’s code book (well, a PDF) with brightly colored words on a black background. Meet Matt and Camper. We want Matt to read our book to Camper before he gets much older, to inspire Camper with the wonderful world of code. I mean, the poor kid has waited his WHOLE life for this book. OUR VISION We knew the right illustrations would bring the book to life and into the hands of future developers. At a party, we saw a cute illustration that our friend Sarah‘s colleague drew of her that perfectly captured Sarah’s warm and spunky personality. We immediately knew we’d found our partner for the code book, someone who would understand our vision and could build on it with his own silly imagination and fabulous creatures. With illustrator Jason Heglund on board, the The Wonderful World of Creatures & Code (aka WWoCC) was finally born. This is the awesome Jason. This guy should get paid for all the nights and weekends he needs to spend illustrating WWoCC away from his wife and daughter. OUR BOOK The Wonderful World of Creatures & Code introduces readers of all ages to foundational code terms and tags used to create websites. The book's world represents our diverse world, with girls, boys, and creatures of all types. WWoCC will be an 8" by 10," full-color hardcover book with premium uncoated linen paper stock—your eyes and hands will thank us. The book is not all fun and games—we worked hard to make sure the illustrations bring each code concept to life. Each drooling creature gets new features added in this lab, just like you add attributes to tags to make them complete. A world of code, kids, creatures, and rhymes WWoCC colorfully illustrates 26 essential HTML tags and fundamental code elements used in making websites—and has integrated “insider” references that developers and engineers will appreciate. Short, rhyming pairs make reading time fun and easy, even with a complex topic. The creature-filled world draws kids in and keeps them hooked as they learn things like the difference between ordered and unordered lists. Who wouldn't want a pink polka-dotted creature with teef like those teaching HTML concepts like how a
tag creates line breaks in a website?!? So darn good. Fun and accurate Written to teach and inspire, The Wonderful World of Creatures & Code presents code terms and concepts in a simple way, rather than dumbing them down. With each WWoCC storytime, readers of all ages get familiar with arguably the most important language of the 21st century, with laughs and funny-toofed creatures along the way. Pirates, unicorns, ice cream-eating creatures, and slobbery aliens teach the basics of making web pages—including cascading style sheets. What more could you possibly want? A perfect 21st-century bedtime story The Wonderful World of Creatures & Code is a must-have baby shower gift and go-to bedtime story for all kids, not just those of developers like our friend Matt. WWoCC is kid tested and developer approved. Please help us bring WWoCC from the drawing board to your child's hands. Just like starts every HTML file, the creature and kid are at the start of their own journey. OUR REQUEST We need your help to get this book into the hands of as many children (and adults) as possible. Please fund this project and spread the word with friends and family. And, if you’re wondering, most of the funds raised will be used to pay Jason the Great (illustrator) and to print and ship the book to you. The rest goes to the super exciting stuff: Fulfillment costs, Kickstarter fees, payment processing fees, freight charges, packaging materials, and copyright costs. Space paint not included. Each pretty penny has its place in creating a quality children's book. OUR REWARDS Here's another rundown of our awesome rewards—but, please be sure to read the full descriptions in the Rewards section. WWoCC FAN CLUB: No physical reward. WHAT A WONDERFUL WORLD: One (1) unsigned first-edition hardcover copy of WWoCC. SIGN ON THE SLOBBERY LINE: One (1) autographed first-edition hardcover copy of WWoCC. Each book will be signed by Amie, Heather, and Jason. SHARING IS CARING: Two (2) unsigned first-edition hardcover copies of WWoCC. LIVE BY THE CODE: Five (5) unsigned first-edition hardcover copies of WWoCC. CREATURE FEATURE: One (1) signed 11" by 14" print of the CSS page and one (1) autographed first-edition hardcover copy of WWoCC. CREATURE COMFORTS: A one-of-a-kind stuffed creature toy from the pages of WWoCC made just for you. Here's an example of the type of stuffed creature you'll receive. Note: these examples are not WWoCC creatures, but they other creatures made by Yvonne, our awesome local craftswoman who will be making your kid's new best friend. We will choose a creature from the book to have made for you. Plus, you also get an autographed first-edition hardcover copy of WWoCC. BECOME IMMORTAL: Three people have the chance to have their kid drawn into the pages of WWoCC. You will need to send us a picture or two and a brief description of your child, and Jason will work his magic. Each of the three kids will make it into one of the inside pages of the book and will be drawn in the style of the rest of the book. You will get an autographed first-edition hardcover copy of WWoCC that features your child on one of the pages. As a reminder, here's how kids look in our world of creatures and code:

What is the Cinematic Smartcase?
The Lumenati CS1 combines the technological features of a digital device (film-free shooting, instant sharing and an editing app) with the cool design, ergonomic ease and natural narrative that the lo-fi classic camera is known for.
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram
Cinematographers simply pop their device into the Lumenati CS1 just as grandpa would load an 8mm film cartridge. The lightweight, portable unit allows anyone to frame and film a steady, stable shot with the pull of an intuitive trigger. A cold shoe allows filmmakers to attach lights, microphones and extra handles for sport shooting. The real-time viewfinder allows WYSIWYG capabilities even in bright light, a feature that is elusive to modern mobile devices. Lenses can be swapped to shoot in wide angle, fisheye and telephoto.  
New Stretch Goal!
Backers vote on which color we will make! If we reach $215,000, every backer will be able to choose between black, white, and the most popular vote! You can vote once a day so make sure you get your favorite color!

The Lumenati CS1 is currently compatible with the iPhone 6 model. However, backers will have the option of being delivered either the iPhone 6 model or the iPhone 6s model (releases October). We hope to offer options for all sizes and smartphones if we are successful in fundraising.
What are people saying?
FastCompany • CNET • Mashable • Observer • Cult of Mac • Design Taxi • Macworld • Indiewire • BuzzFeed • Business Insider • Inc.
 The Lumenati CS1 uses an optical-quality glass lensing system. Our lenses range from wide angle to telephoto and deliver crisp stunning images. The lenses are designed for high resolution HD cameras and when paired with the CS1 create the perfect look for any occasion. Standard 58mm interchangeable lensing provides even more versatility with available super wide and fish eye lenses.

campaign.story:
The Golden Beaker is an educational board game focused on teaching children the fundamentals of chemistry. It takes between thirty and sixty minutes and can be played by two to six people. While the rules are easy enough for children as young as eight to understand and enjoy, older children will keep coming back for the surprisingly strategic gameplay.
In the game, each player takes on the role of one of six scientists competing for the coveted Golden Beaker, a trophy given out to the finest chemist in the world. To win this illustrious prize, they must collect element cards in order to complete a variety of molecules from their workbench. Be careful though, players need to take care when collecting elements because any they don’t use will reduce their score at the end of the game.
So, why do we need your help? An excellent question! Board games are expensive to produce, especially those designed for children. These games require more vigorous testing to ensure the safety of the components. This means we need to have a run of at least 1,500 games in order to bring the unit price down enough to be affordable. In addition, we’d use some of the funds to create the final art. We love the way our prototypes look, but there’s always room for polish.
6 Scientist Boards
112 Element Cards
36 Molecule Tiles
Instruction Book
Parent Teacher Guide
From the beginning, our goal has been to deliver STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) based games that are both fun and educational. Surely, there must be a lot of games like that out there already... right? That’s what we thought until we did the research. To our surprise and disappointment, there just isn’t a lot out there, and for most of the games we found, education seemed to be an afterthought, a gimmick used to sell games that were poorly thought out.
Our games are different!  While fun is at the heart of everything we create, we also make sure that education is a first class citizen in each of these games. To that end, all our games come with both an instruction book and a Parent/Teacher Guide. While the instructions emphasize the simple, easy-to-learn nature of all our games, the Parent/Teacher Guide gives detailed ideas on how the game can be used to teach a variety of educational principles. We also help educators map game concepts to a number of widely used standards: Common Core, National Science Standards, etc
See what else we're working on at www.guidedplaygames.com, and check out our facebook page at www.facebook.com/thegoldenbeaker
The larger the run of games we can produce, the lower our unit cost. That means that as we hit our stretch goals we’ll be able to include more components in each copy of the game. These additions come in the form of new elements along with their corresponding molecules.
$100k – Silicon Expansion
 In addition to the element cards, we’ll include the following molecules: Silicon Carbide (Carborundum), Silicon Dioxide (Silica), and Disilicon HexaHydride (Disilane).
$150k – Boron Expansion
In addition to the element cards, we’ll include the following molecules: Diborane, Boron Trifluoride, and Boron Trioxide.
$200k – Magnesium Expansion
In addition to the element cards, we’ll include the following molecules: Magnesium Chloride, Magnesium Difluoride, and Magnesium Oxide.
We thought it might be helpful to put together a few videos explaining some of the mechanics of the game. Hopefully, this gives you a better glimpse into what our game is all about.

My Magical Adventure is a printed personalized children’s book, whose lead character can be customized to look like any child, including all ethnicities and special needs.
We want to celebrate diversity and created a first-of-its-kind children's book. All our books are printed uniquely and will be as diverse as the little ones reading them.

Everyone loved it, but while reading the book, she could only point at his name and never say "Look! That's you in the book!" Her nephew just looked very different than the lead character. What started as the idea to create a book for her nephew, quickly grew into the mission to create a book for every child.

campaign.story:
Hi my name is Holly and I'm an entrepreneur, businesswoman, and storytelling mom.  I've been a girlpreneur for as long as I can remember. As a young girl I loved working at my parent's business or doing my own thing like creating backyard carnivals to raise money for an animal shelter and selling interesting leaves from my front yard (to very kind people passing by).   Having an entrepreneurial spirit at an early age helped me to be successful as I grew up whether it was at multinational companies or startups.  I want to share this excitement and self empowerment with girls.
Introducing Bright Girls
I’ve written a full length book with great illustrations and activities for girls (age 8-12) to learn about business so that they can envision themselves as entrepreneurs, business leaders and CEOs. 
The book, Your Own Business Can Be Great, tells the story of two girls, Lucy and Kylie who create a business from idea to execution.  It's packed with activities and fun quizzes. The book teaches concepts including:
Brainstorming
Testing your idea
Creating a product
Networking
Profit & Cost of Goods
Marketing and more!
These are skills she'll use throughout her life.
Why is This Important? The Gender Gap.
The average revenue of a woman owned business is just 25% of her male counterparts.  Experts say the solution is to get girls interested in entrepreneurialism before high school.  Let's close the gap together!
She'll Change Her World
Whether she grows up to be a scientist, chef, coder, doctor, artist, or whatever she dreams up, understanding business will help her to be successful and change her world. 
Rewards
The Book
You can choose to get an eBook, printed book or both!   The book (over 90 pages) includes great illustrations, a story, and fun activities so that the readers experience the business adventure with the characters and think about how they would create, name, brainstorm, solve problems and even price their own product. 
Be The Coolest Girlpreneur On The Block!
We have created the "Changing my world" t-shirt that we LOVE and hope you will too.  Lucy wears it in the book and we’ve made the design “human size” for kids and adults. You can get it now exclusively through this Kickstarter campaign!  
Bringing Business to Life
I am also offering a kit for the readers to make the Be Great product Lucy and Kylie create in the book, truly bringing the business to life. Each kit includes one set of completed hair ties/bracelets and enough material, charms, and instructions for your girlpreneur to make 4 more sets. The meaning of Be Great is revealed in the book.(small parts not for children under 3 years).
New Reward!!  You Can Be in The Book!!
We just added these new very special rewards. An illustration of you, another adult, or your child can be included in the books.  Join the girlpreneur movement by literally being in the book!
These are exclusive and limited opportunities!
Here's a breakdown of what the campaign will fund:
Book printing
Shipping costs (to me and then to you)
Production, materials and fulfillment of all the rewards
Stretch Goal $15,000:  If we hit $15,000 I'll be able to add more characters and create a module for non-profits, teachers, afterschool programs and girls clubs that I'll provide for free. (I would love to do this!)
Like us on Facebook. Follow us on Twitter.

Every minute of every day, beers are abandoned, lost and wasted. Fresh craft brew, spilled and gone. Perhaps you are savoring your favorite beer throughout the night and just want to keep it fresh. Or maybe you just don’t want your beer spilling all over where it shouldn't be. Either way, we've got the answer!
It’s time to save the beer. 
Follow along on social with the #SAVETHEBEER hashtag
Introducing Pop & Stop, one of the world’s first two-in-one bottle opener and sealer, made right here in the USA using 3D printer technology.
Simple Sealing
BUT… most products on the market don’t solve the problem well. This one does.
PLAY

Open. Drink. Seal.  It's that simple!
Key chain sized, it’s perfect for replacing that old bottle opener you have because it comes with the added capability of sealing the beer bottle, trapping that wonderful, wonderful carbonation. 
The secret to anti-gravity beer
Pop & Stop is ideal for you, and really, anyone who loves beer. 
Designed by an Aerospace engineer and beer lover, we are raising money to take this product to the next level.  Right now, we are using a 3D printer to make these.  That's cool, but what we really need is a mold to help take this to the next level. 
We plan on keeping all the manufacturing in the USA, so we need your help. The rise of craft beer is an American phenomenon--let's keep it local.  The mold will help us customize Pop & Stop for you or your company.  When we raise enough money for a plastic mold, we'll take it to the next step with metal--an aerospace-grade item. Think of all the beer you will save for you and others... Support us and share with your friends!
Share on Facebook!
Some of the ways Pop & Stop serves you:
1. Keeps the freshness of your beer for 48 hrs or more
2. Keeps strangers or friends from adding things to your beer
3. Helps avoid spillage during bumps, drops and knocks
4. Opens and seals at your leisure
5. Identifies your beer with different color options or personalization
6. Works on all beer types except some twist offs
7. Works on most glass bottled soda
8. Each unit opens hundreds of bottles in its lifetime
We are patent pending and have a dozen more designs we are hoping to launch in 2015, along with many more functional applications.
First and foremost, our passion started with craft beer and the tremendous waste we saw of a national treasure. Help us help the nation and the industry! Join the movement and we will all be eternally thankful!
Support, share, promote and let us know if we can help in any way!

https://www.facebook.com/farsicknessfilm
This short film focuses on 75 year-old Walter Wexler, a man who goes missing only to be found 24 hours later, insisting that he has spent the day fulfilling his lifelong dream of traveling the world. When he is met with doubt, he turns to his similarly wanderlust-stricken granddaughter, Dorothy, to prove his adventures.
This tale of magical realism draws on one of the many beauties of the human experience- the capacity to dream beyond one's means. With themes of love, family, and the realization of dreams nearly missed, this story was largely inspired by Pixar's UP and Ben Stiller's The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, films that celebrate the tenacity of the human spirit.
At this point in pre-production, we have at the ready:
Locked script
Budget report
Production reports
Production schedules
Look book
If for any reason you would like to see our budget report, feel free to ask! That document can be somewhat dense, however; so to put it quickly, we are raising funds for:
Food for the cast and crew on set
Location permits & fees
Wardrobe and set dressing
Access to more film equipment
Promotional materials and DVD printing
Professional colour grading/post production outsourcing
Festival submission fees
Paisley Hearney - Writer/Director
Now nearly halfway through with her final year in university, Paisley Hearney has spent years immersing herself in film theory, production, and the various stages of development. Having worked on various other short film sets, both student and independent, and put in time as a videographer for Northern Arizona University's marketing department, she is excited to bring her ever-developing skill set to this short film that she has already been hard at work on since May. Paisley looks forward to sharing this project, the first of this scale that she has directed, with her incredibly supportive friends, family, peers, and community.
vimeo: https://vimeo.com/paisleyhearney/
online résumé: http://paisleyhearney.tumblr.com/
Robin Cook - Producer
A Flagstaff resident since 1991, Robin Cook has many roles in life: mother of two, wife, full-time employee at Northern Arizona University, and a student of Electronic Media & Film and History. She has long enjoyed camera work, and has lent her talents to NAU's NAZ Today as well as a number of recent short films as an assistant camera operator and an assistant director- and now, as a producer. The rest of the creative team of farsickness. are beyond excited to have someone as dedicated as Robin working on this project.
Amber Fields - Cinematographer
Amber is a senior in Northern Arizona University's Electronic Media & Film program. She has been involved with a few short films previously, including UTV62's A Grim Tale and Act Your Age. Amber hopes to work primarily in independent films while owning and operating her own food truck. She is the youngest of five in her family, and a first generation college student. She will be graduating this spring.
Shannon Dirgo - Production Designer
With nearly a year's past experience as a production designer on various short film sets, Shannon Dirgo has a lot to bring to this set. Her involvement extends to procuring the set, props, and costumes, and making sure these things look correct according to the director, working off of her vision and inspiration. She looks forward to working on this set and bringing this film to life.
Ben Rockoff - Composer
A graduate of Northern Arizona University's School of Music and member of the Shrine of the Ages Choir, Ben Rockoff is a talented musician greatly looking forward to applying his talents to the creation of this short film's score.
(The music featured in the trailer above was "Dowl," by Podington Bear.)

campaign.story:
Kidokey lets you decide when your kids can have Internet access, what sites they can browse and what apps they can use.
Kidokey plugs right into your home router, and creates a second wi-fi network for your kids. No other installation required.
Kidokey works with all devices connected to its wi-fi network, like tablets, phones, laptops and desktops.
We know that you don’t have time to check every site on the Internet so we have done the work for you. Every web site your kids can access has been reviewed by real people from our team, not a computer program. Kidokey comes with 100s of thousands of sites already reviewed by our team and you can also add/remove sites as you wish.
Kidokey is filled with simple yet essential features. For example, you can limit your kids to accessing education sites only when they do their homework!
Plug & Play
Kidokey is a very simple solution to distraction-free, safe Internet content for kids. The Kidokey box plugs right into your existing router and that's it. You just have to change your existing wi-fi password if your kids know it.
Scheduling & Time Management
Kidokey comes pre-set with sensible website controls and time management defaults that you can easily adjust to fit your family’s needs. A simple daily schedule shows what sites can be accessed and when. 
There's 3 possible settings for each time period: access to all authorized sites, just the educational ones (we call it "homework time") or no Internet access.
White List Filtering
At Kidokey, a team of people works behind the scenes to review and categorize every website and app your kids can access. We use a ‘white list’ approach to building the database. ‘White list’ means only approved sites are allowed and everything else is blocked. This is the safest filtering solution.
We also evaluate the educational value of sites – so you can rest assured that when it’s time for homework, there won't be any additional distractions. 
Parental Controls Easy on Parents 
Kidokey is all about simple. The Parent Dashboard is where you control the settings of your Kidokey box. It is a tablet and mobile-friendly website that resides on the cloud, so you can easily override policies in effect from anywhere. For example, approve the use of a web site on your mobile phone from work.
Kid-friendly Search Engine
From their Kidokey home page, your kids can search their own version of the web, see what sites you have recently approved and check out our Staff Picks. 
App & Game Controls
The Kidokey box filters everything on its Wi-Fi network, not just web pages. Using the Parent Dashboard, you can select what apps or games you want to allow access to and when. 
Database Updates
Maintaining such a wide database of kid-friendly sites and apps is a lot of work, but so is taking care of your kids. We strive to keep Kidokey both affordable and accessible. When you purchase the Kidokey box, you also get one year of free database updates (2 years for Kickstarter backers). After that, updates are available on a yearly basis for $25. 
But we don’t want you to pay for database updates! For each friend that you refer and who also purchases a Kidokey box, you’ll receive another full year of free database updates. It’s a win-win for everyone.
Check out the early-bird special rewards. Be one of the first to support the project and you'll get lifetime database updates!
Age-based Access
We rate and categorize websites and apps by age groups. Some sites are classified as great for teenagers but inappropriate for pre-teens or younger ones. To ensure that your kids are accessing age-appropriate content, the Kidokey search engine takes your kid’s age into account when returning search results.
Content in Your Language
Kidokey is multi-lingual. You can easily set the list of languages that you want to be available to your kids. 
All the details on our web site at kidokey.com.
Latest prototype (3D printed -- ignore the rough aspect)
This blue wonder uses the latest wi-fi chips to give your kids the best speed possible. 
Various stages of the box design
I'm a software engineer and entrepreneur. I have two sons, now 15 and 13. 
A few years ago, when they got their own computers, I worked hard to engage the operating system's parental control. It was just two computers to maintain, and it was just bearable. But when they got additional devices (iPods, iPads, etc.) things got messy and I started to look for Wi-Fi routers that had some sort of filtering. I found nothing satisfying. The user experience was terrible at best and updating the list of sites was always a tedious process. So, I modified a Wi-Fi router for them.
Life went on and I quickly realized that I wasn't the only one to encounter these issues. The multiplication of devices was making it harder and harder on parents all around me. My entrepreneurial spirit kicked in (it's not my first company) and I started work full-time on Kidokey with two goals: ease of use (for both parents and kids) and safety.
- Finalize the box firmware.
- Source the power adapter and Ethernet cable.
- Deploy the back-end servers in a scalable way.
- Launch the production of the box and order the electronic boards in volume.
- Design and order the packaging.
- Test, test, test, test.

The funds gathered in the campaign will be used to pay for production costs, order the first batch of electronics and hire a few key people that are already working with us part-time.


 As soon as the KS campaign completes, we'll trigger the volume order of the box shell and its electronics. There's about 4 to 6 weeks of lead time. Meanwhile, we'll commission the extra back-end servers and heavily test the whole thing.

This gives us a planned release in March 2015. 

Christmas special ! If you want to offer Kidokey for Christmas, we'll send you a fancy Gift Certificate to put under the tree!

The production of the box and its assembly will be done here in Canada.

campaign.story:
A wearable, "learning" device that makes you and your dog smarter and better looking.   ;-)
 Read all our news releases here. 
Have you ever been humiliated when your new friends come over and your dog proceeds to jump all over them no matter what you say? 
Well, YOU, my friend, need a WÜF! 
Have you ever been terrified or brought to tears when your dog ran away from home and you thought you’d never see your best friend again?? 
Then WÜF is perfect for you. 
Have you ever missed your dog so much when away at work and wish you had a way to check in and say hi? 
Well, you guessed it - WÜF is for you too! 
Have you ever been concerned about your dog’s health, wondering if he’s getting the exercise he needs or if you’ll even know when to bring him to the vet? 
WÜF is happy to help you. 
Have you ever wished that your dog respect you more and was better under your control?  
Then you’ve come to the right place because WÜF is definitely for you!
WÜF is a dog collar unlike any that have come before. WÜF is not just for training or tracking, but rather for learning.
With a unique combination of hardware, tucked inside a beautifully designed case, WÜF studies and understands your dog’s movements, sounds, activities, locations and interactions, in order to gather a full picture of his lifestyle and habits.
Once WÜF understands who your dog is, we start to learn what sort of relationship you and your dog have together. From the walks you go on, to the way you talk to each other and what your favorite playtime activity is.
This learning allows us to provide simple and actionable ways to improve on the major challenges (barking, pulling on leash, anxiety, etc.) and find even more ways to bond and play (new games at the park, advanced training, etc.).
With one suggestion a day, our goal is simple, to help dog owners around the world have a Good Dog, Every Day.
Inputs
Microphone - We can hear when he barks, understand the type of bark and even listen for external causes for the bark.This allows us to recognize patterns in his barking that help us find the root of the bark rather than addressing the symptom.
GPS - Main purpose is for peace of mind that your pup is never lost, but also handy to show us where they go on a daily basis.Do they have a perimeter that they must inspect every morning and what does this say about them being territorial?
Accelerometer - Measuring their activity to see when they are most (in)active, how much they sleep during the day and how far the walker really walked them to learn how many calories they burn so we know how much to feed them.
Bluetooth - BLE (Low Energy) connects to “smart” devices inside and outside the house to exchange information about location, proximity, speed and more. Can be used to snap a picture from your DropCam, to turn on the DOG TV, or even to detect if he’s going in a room he doesn’t belong in.
Outputs
Speaker - Say “hi” when you are missing them at work, work on obedience through voice commands or enable the invisible leash for off-leash control (more on that below). There are so many possibilities for training, safety and games when you can talk to your dog from anywhere.
Vibration - More humane than a shock while still useful for getting his attention.
Bluetooth - Constant connection with smartphone to share information about distance apart, “Best Friend Time” and other contextual data.
GSM - Utilizing the 2g/3g networks, we keep your family connected around the world, even when separated by oceans and time zones.
By pre-ordering through our Kickstarter campaign, you will receive your WÜF before anyone else in the world, you can get a limited edition color, you can become a beta tester (ask us!), you can get a full year of premium for free, you have a voice in our final development and you also help a startup bring a powerful idea to life. 
We take care of our friends. Contribute today and let us show you how. :-)
We believe that the training industry is ripe for a rethink. Everyday, we witness owners who have the best intentions but a lack of guidance in getting the “dog of their dreams”. With trends like “flipping the classroom”, MOOCs or Gamified language learning, the traditional ways that we learn are being challenged and updated.
WUF is doing the same thing for dog training. With fun, daily exercise, supported by data, WUF is bringing a whole new concept to becoming the pack leader to fit our active, mobile lives.
"No more lost dogs" is just the beginning! GPS is vital, but is only just scratching the surface of what's possible with WÜF.
Through customer development, speaking with hundreds of owners, trainers and vets, we looked at the entire relationship to discover what would be most useful in a "wearable" device. This led to our unique and patent-pending combination of hardware, including microphone and speaker, to inspire a whole new slew of capabilities and benefits. 
Because, having a dog is a lifestyle and every way we can learn how to bring more balance to it, means healthier and better behaved pups living with happier families, friends and neighbors.  
Some of the things we’ve mentioned above have been tried before. The GPS and activity tracking are obvious, with several startup companies creating products that do just that, while training products have been around for years that include shock, vibration and anti-bark methodologies.
Not a single one of these products is taking the approach that WUF has invented, turning a product that is always with your dog into a learning device that recognizes, analyzes and advises in real time. 
Finally an e-collar that looks cool. Our device is sleek, modern and attractive. Further, it comes in multiple colors and has an interchangeable system so you can accessorize and personalize your pup’s look. Just imagine, vibrant orange for a trip to the park, cool grey when walking around town and camo for the weekend in the woods.
Close up of our latest prototype
Renderings of WÜF's Two Main Colors
Latest Renderings with SAMPLE Collars
Rendering of WÜF internals
WÜF's smartphone app follows the "Freemium" app model. There is a core version that will ALWAYS BE FREE alongside multiple ways to upgrade the experience with a-la-carte Premium Features. 
Learn more about our Free and Premium features in the FAQs below.
Industrial Design
By splitting the product into two pieces, the Brains and the Case, our collar allows dog owners around the world to find the perfect style to express their (dog's) personality. 
We are launching with a couple core cases, with the future of "WÜF Wear" holding unlimited options to personalize your pup's look. 
Externally, our approach combines an appealing, minimalist design with a soft, yet durable, outer case, creating a contoured feel for comfort and a eye-catching look for self-expression. 
Internally, we’ve designed the electronics to maximize space, providing for optimal battery capacity and antenna reception. Fitting inside a waterproof shell, the brains can pop into and out of any case you want.
Safe
As the technologies are the same as in human smartphones, they have been extensively tested and approved for humans to use, let alone dogs. So, if you ever want to put one on your kid or significant other, they would be totally safe too!
Disclaimer - WÜF is not responsible for any relationship issues that result from the above suggested idea. ;-p
Biteproof
So when your two 120 pound dobermans are roughhousing in the backyard, no matter who wins, WÜF comes out on top.
The outer case is made of similar materials to the most durable dog toys while the “brains” are tucked away in a hard, molded plastic shell.
Waterproof
Go ahead, swim, roll in the mud, take a shower, do what dogs do! Our smart collar device will stay fully functional, safe and dry up to at least 1 meter of water.
Shockproof
Considering the playful nature of dogs, WÜF collar device must be shockproof. All the delicate electronics are enclosed in a rigid enclosure protected by a flexible outer cover for plenty of ample cushioning. 
 Main Hardware Features
Accelerometer
Our 6 axis motion processing unit captures the entire range of doggie movements. We can detect and learn all about your dog's favorite ways to move:
Movement: Up, down, left, right, forward, backward.
Positioning: lean right/left, bend forward/backward, turn side/side. 
GPS
Our 48 channel GPS includes advanced power saving modes and assisted tracking; we can track your pup’s movements in dense city environments and deep wooded areas.
Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)
Bluetooth 4.1, the industry's latest standard. Our algorithms automatically default to BLE when in range so as to maximize its extreme power saving advantages.
Cellular + IoT network
CURRENT: Quad band 2G and 3G enabled. Cellular networks enable WÜF to connect to your smartphone when away from your pup. 
FUTURE: IoT networks like Helium or SigFox are currently being evaluated for potential use in first generation product.
Processor
ARM cortex microprocessor with dedicated digital signal processing unit. The heart of the device has its own embedded operating system, swiftly managing all of the functionality and features.
Intelligent Power Management
Power management IC with over-voltage, under-voltage and short circuit protection connected to Lithium Polymer battery.
Current setup achieves 5 day battery life on second generation prototype. Goal is to make it so you never have to take the collar off to charge, with new wireless charging technologies hopefully making that possible. 
Main Software Features

GPS Tracking + Geo Fencing
Peace of mind to always know where your dog is. Let's work together to a future with no more lost dog signs! 
Set the “fence” around your yard and if your dog leaves the area, you’ll be be notified to start tracking immediately.
Activity Monitoring
Charts and graphs are cool for a bit, but eventually get old. We calculate it all for you and give you the one metric that really matters for your dog's health: How much do I feed my dog today?
Beyond that, we’ll provide ongoing suggestions to live a healthy, active lifestyle based on age, breed, season and location to get you off the couch and keep you moving!
Two-Way Audio
A “smart microphone” listens in and sends you alerts if your dog is barking a lot, crying, whining, growling or whimpering unexpectedly.
A powerful speaker allows you to talk to your dog from anywhere in world, whether to check in when away at work, or to train with manual or automatic commands such as “sit”, “stay”, “down” and more. 
Invisible Leash
The off-leash control you’ve always wanted! Let your pup wander: just set the perimeter around you and WÜF will keep him as close or far as you desire.
Based on two-way audio, vibration and our included training program (think “advanced clicker training”) whenever your dog approaches the perimeter, it’ll receive a series of commands to: a) stop, b) listen and c) come on back to you to get a treat or affection!
Training
Bite sized training programs to build you up into the family’s top dog trainer, 10 minutes at a time.
Games
Few ideas: 
1) Augmented reality RPG with you and your dog as the main characters.  
2) Geo-Caching with your dog in on the hunt. 
3) The Quiet Game :-) 
Have an idea for a cool game? Connect with us and lets build it together. 
Gamification
At the end of the day, living with a dog should be FUN! Our platform adds Gamification elements to encourage, support and reward you for doing the tough stuff, while throwing in some competition for you and your fellow dog “parent” friends.
The Hardware Evolution
From development boards strewn across a desk to a tight, 2x quarter sized PCB with dozens of components nested into a compact design.
The Software Evolution
Just like the hardware, our software has gone through several iterations. From an MVP app (below) that proves the concept, to a fully immersive UX that highlights only the most important things for you, each day.
PLAY

Color
Gray is sleek while Orange has pop. Which one is best for your pup? 
Size
How big is your pup? Our devices will come in a standard size range for small, medium, large/extra large dogs, based on the following collar widths:
Large strap opening: 1 inch (2.54 cm), 
Medium strap opening: ¾ of an inch (1.9 cm), and 
Small strap opening: ⅝ of an inch (1.6 cm).
We’ve gotten to this point as bootstrapping entrepreneurs, on what we like to say, “one tank of gas”. Now we are ready to FUEL UP and take things to the next level. 
We've garnered great support and excitement in our local networks and are now coming to Kickstarter to attain an initial market validation that we need to prove that this product is a winner and has the potential to improve the lives for millions of dog owners around the world. 
We need your help to prove this demand and enable WÜF to become a true market reality. Thank You!
From left: Azmat, Sean and Lizelle in Boulder, Colorado Headquarters.
Team WÜF is comprised of 6 incredible team members, and is headquartered in beautiful Boulder, Colorado, USA! 
We have literally lived and worked all over the world while making WÜF a reality. From Germany, to New York, Chicago, Paris, Pakistan, Boulder and Denver, our team has stuck together through all adversity one can imagine. We've stuck with it for a reason and are honored to finally bring our hard work to all of you.

Long story short, we are not just a group of kids in a basement building a project, but rather a sharp, savvy and capable team combining some youthful exuberance with industry veterans to ensure that we build not just a product but a real company. 
We could not be doing this without these incredibly supportive companies. Thank you folks!
  Thank You Everyone! With your help, the future is looking bright!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Wearable technology for dogs is very new to the world and we are working very hard to build something disruptively innovative that has never been done before. This means biting off as much as we can chew (no pun intended, we swear!) and challenging ourselves to live up to it.

With a strong team of strategists supported by industry veterans, we've developed plans to tackle all of the accompanying hurdles. As such, we welcome your questions on how WÜF handles all challenges, surrounding: 

• Industrial design to fit all dogs
• Materials selection for long lasting durability
• Battery life to set a new standard in wearables
• Complexities around embedded systems engineering
• Component selection for multi-year technology relevancy
• Manufacturing setup and production in Asia
• Supply chain management of 40+ individual components

campaign.story:
“The nudge in the ribs was short of a kick, but not by much. “ – The Jesuit Letter
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
UPDATE: As The Jesuit Letter kickstarter project looks like it is headed north of its goal, I've pulled together some ideas for stretch goals and stretch backer rewards!
Stretch Goal # 1: $3,500  
Stretch Reward # 1: The extra funding will be allocated to commissioning an artist to develop a map of Elizabethan Warwickshire to augment the book. The map will be available in high resolution digital format for all WHIP-JACK ($10) and above reward levels, with print versions (ideally on some beautiful quality paper) also available for all backers at ANGLER ($25) level and above.  
Stretch Goal # 2: $4,000 
Stretch Reward # 2: The extra funding will be allocated to commissioning an artist to develop a character sketches of the main four characters in the book. As before, the character sketches will be available in high resolution digital format for all WHIP-JACK ($10) and above reward levels, with print versions (ideally on some beautiful quality paper) also available for all backers at ANGLER ($25) level and above. 
Suggestions?  If you have any suggestions for other stretch rewards, I am very open to suggestions! I had considered an audio version of the book, but after investigating, at this time it looks like the production costs associated with that idea make it out of reach at this point.
Thanks!
Dean
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I was reading a biography of William Shakespeare when all the threads and my loose thoughts coalesced into a storyline, a tale that seemed worth telling -  the story of an ex-soldier turned play-actor, caught up the dangerous uncertainty of the English Reformation...and the vagaries of an eleven-year old Will Shakespeare. 
Most fiction embedded in the Elizabethan era tends to be bodice-ripping tales of Court intrigue, set amidst the silken splendor of palaces.  Mine tends to hang about in ale-soaked taverns, muddy streets and fetid back-alleys where cold-steel by lantern light offers redemption or grim death by turns…
The Jesuit Letter is the result: 112,000-odd words of historical fiction, hung together in 25 chapters of murder, mayhem and copious amounts of sword-play.
Here’s a brief summary:
The Jesuit Letter reader copy cover
The innyards of London are closed due to plague, and the Earl of Worcester’s Men are on the road, touring through the market-towns of the midlands. Ex-soldier turned play-actor Christopher Tyburn finds himself entangled in a murderous and deadly conspiracy when he intercepts a coded letter from a hidden Jesuit priest in Warwickshire. 
Tyburn thought he had left bloodshed and violence behind him when he abandoned the war against the Spanish in Flanders.  Now, stalked by an unknown enemy, he must race to unmask the true nature of the conspiracy and hunt down the Jesuit to clear his name, or die a traitor’s death.
You can read an excerpt from The Jesuit Letter below or read the first three chapters on my website. As an added bonus, the opening chapter of Thieves Castle, the work-in-progress sequel, is also up...
PLAY

Excerpt:
It was all about waiting. 
Flanders had been damp and cold and dull and dangerous.  The motley collection of soldiers in the Lowlands that made up the small English expedition under Morgan and Gilbert had been a mélange of ex-Sea Beggars, Prussian mercenaries, English soldiers-of-fortune and rake-hell adventurers, leavened with a healthy mix of brutal Scottish Highlanders and amoral Dutchmen.  They were hard, cruel and unscrupulous men, men who prized loot, fighting, drink and women.  They were routinely drunk, undisciplined, licentious and lice-ridden.  They fought among themselves almost as much as they fought the Spaniards but fight they did.  They had honed their belligerent skills in the dank and stony streets of Edinburgh and Haarlem, in the hard arenas of clan warfare and on the chill decks of the Dutch brigand fleet. 
In their ranks, Tyburn had been well-schooled.
The man stepped forward, looking to close fast and pull the interloper off balance, to reach out with his massive calloused hands and break this bastard player.
Waiting was over.
Tyburn sidestepped and slammed his open hand into the lunging man’s throat.  The man gagged and choked, both hands inadvertently pulling away from their intended target.  Tyburn’s booted foot raked down the man’s instep and he lurched forward, his advance turning into a painful stumble, Tyburn arced a hard closed left fist into the man’s right ear and another into his stomach.  As his opponent bent over, Tyburn levered his arm and slammed him headfirst into the cornerpost with a sickening crack.
The man fell like a brick.
Cuttle glared up at the player and rose, head swimming.  One hand dropped to his belt, grasping the bone hilt of his dagger.
Tyburn regarded Cuttle with a chary stare and flipped back his yellow cloak, tapping the hilt of his rapier.  “That’s a path you don’t want to tread, friend.” he said in a mild tone, shaking his head.
What's been done?
The book is 100% complete, but as I learned, writing is only part of the road to publication.
The next step lies before me: going from words on paper to a fully published novel.
Publication is a journey and, although self-publishing today is click-of-a-button-simple, putting out a good book – one that has few typos, a nice layout and structure, well-edited & graced with brilliantly compelling cover art – can be expensive.
I have invested significant time and effort in research, writing and re-writing, aimed at creating a compelling and exciting story set in the Elizabethan world, while trying to keep it as historically accurate as possible. 
What's needed to bring this tale to publication? 
To bring a good product to market - in this case the first novel in a planned series - you need to provide a quality reading experience and value for readers.  That means superlative writing, a great story and a terrific reading experience.  This requires professional editing, proofing, layout design (interior & exterior), multiple e-book formats, and a great cover.
Successful publication also requires marketing, in order to be visible and promoted to the widest possible reading audience.  That's easy if you are in the hands of a major publisher, but much harder if you are on your own.
Editing, design and marketing
These are the three items that bring me to Kickstarter.  I need capital support to help me bring the book to the publication stage.  This involves sourcing & hiring:
1).  A great copy editor
2). A layout designer to help manage the interior design layout so a reader's experience is flawless and smooth no matter if it be a Kindle, Kobo, Nook or a print copy.
3). A cover designer who can capture the energy & excitement of the story and help get readers to pick it off the shelf.
What do you get?
Aside from my undying gratitude, some great rewards and a well-spun story, your investment in the publication of The Jesuit Letter isn't just the start of this tale, it is the start of a SERIES.  Tyburn's tale is planned to encompass a significant part of the Elizabethan reign, from the 1570's through to at least 1588 and the advent of the Armada.
Once the first book is off the ground, the others will follow.  The second book, Thieves Castle, is currently 1/3 complete and is slated to be done by the end of 2014, followed by book three, Sorcerer's Street, and at least two more that are in the early planning stages.  
Investing in a Kickstarter is about more than just swag, its about the opportunity to help support, create, develop and build an endeavor. 
Nobody likes to wait!  If project supporters are interested in receiving the unedited advance per-release digital copy of The Jesuit Letter immediately (i.e. no waiting til September!) I would be more than pleased to provide it as an Advance Edition to the various reward levels.
Even if you decide that The Jesuit Letter isn't for you, poke about and throw your support behind some of the other projects on Kickstarter.  Ideas and dreams always can use a little bit of help or a nudge in the right direction.
I hope you decide to be a part of it.

campaign.story:
Vixle is Creative - In an era of Internet-shared photos and videos, Vixle lets you express yourself in unique new ways. Cheer up a sick friend by building a game to play with them. Thank someone more personally with a one-of-a-kind interactive card. Build a game as a school project, which shows off your knowledge of the topic in a fun way.
Vixle is Social - From creating code, art, and sound, to playing games or hanging out, everything you can do in Vixle can be done side-by-side with a friend, whether they are on a computer next to you, or across the globe. Families can build and play together, working at different skill levels, but without leaving anyone behind.
Vixle is Easy To Learn - Everyone is a novice at something, and so we've made each activity in Vixle easy to learn. From adults with no programming experience to middle schoolers, everyone should be comfortable learning to use Vixle. Even younger kids will be fine, with a little guidance.
Vixle is Powerful - In order to build together, Vixle needs to support all skill levels, so the tools grow with you. More powerful code editing and APIs are available. Richer and more detailed models and animations can be created. Assets you create in other tools can be brought into Vixle, and vice versa.
Vixle is Code - What separates interactive media like games from video, images, and text? Code. It's the lifeblood of your game, and it's front-and-center in Vixle. Get started with block code (similar to Scratch or Blockly), and then move on when you're ready. Eventually you'll look at all the devices in your life, and realize the power you have over them.
Start with Block Code
Progress to Lua
Vixle Maker is the software you receive at the BETA pledge level and above. It runs on Windows, Mac, and Linux, and allows you to build worlds and play with other Vixle users on your network. Our servers help connect you and your friends, so play over the Internet is often possible without Hosting.
Vixle Explorer is free for everyone, and enables anyone to play the games you've built with Vixle Maker. It runs in a web browser and on mobile devices, to make it easy to share your creations with friends and family who don't have Vixle. Only your hosted worlds can be played by Vixle Explorer.
Starting in May 2015, you'll get 1 year of free Hosting for one of your worlds. Hosted worlds run on our computers to ensure uniform access and performance, and can be played with Vixle Explorer. You'll have the option to renew Hosting for your personal account at an estimated $1 per month. Even if you don't renew, Vixle Maker is yours to use forever.
Vixle Maker will be released with 3 Asset Packs in the fantasy, sci-fi, and modern genres. Accounts with an active Hosting subscription will receive an additional Asset Pack every 6 months, as well as the ability to share their own models with other Vixle users in a community gallery. Some of our stretch goals accelerate the release of more Asset Packs.
Although it's not software, we want to call out the short story offered to backers at FICTION level, "Journey to Galaxy's Edge." Brian was first inspired to learn programming by the Micro Adventure series in the 80s. The exciting stories transformed you into a hero who uses coding skills to overcome obstacles.
In the same way, Journey includes scenes which prompt the reader to play a game or solve a programming challenge, using Vixle. The challenges encourage experimentation to foster an intuitive understanding of how the code works. The reader can then copy the scenes to their own worlds in order to further play with and expand them.
We have a few demos for you to check out, which show the progress we've made. They run directly in your browser, with the help of the popular Unity web player.  Most Windows and Mac browsers are supported, and HTML5 support is planned for later in the year.
Auger - A fully working game running on the current version of Vixle Explorer.
Modeler - A standalone voxel editor, enabling you to build 3D models similar to how you will in Vixle Maker. The models you create can then be saved as images or shared with your friends. In the future, you'll also be able to order 3D prints of your model, directly from within Vixle. Using the Modeler requires logging in with a Google+ or Facebook account, so that we can save your work.
Journey to Galaxy's Edge - A preview of the story available with the FICTION tier, along with a concept video of the first challenge.
All of our pledge levels up to ALPHA include all of the rewards at the previous levels. Here we give the full list at each level, along with a little more explanation.
$5 - HIGH FIVE - Digital desktop wallpaper and icons suitable for social media avatars, ideal for showing your support for Vixle.
$20 - BETA - The digital images, plus a copy of Vixle Maker when it goes beta, estimated at the end of this year. The software will be released on Windows, Mac, and Linux. Your personal account will include two usernames, which allows two people to use Vixle at the same time on different computers. Starting in May 2015, you'll also get one year of hosting.
$25 - FICTION - The digital images, Vixle Maker with 2 usernames and 1 year of hosting, and a digital copy of the short story "Journey to Galaxy's Edge," which includes 6 introductory programming challenges as part of the plot. Any additional stories that are unlocked by stretch goals will be yours as well.
$40 - FAMILY - The digital images and story, and Vixle Maker with a total of 5 usernames and 1 year of hosting. Vixle is ideal for families and friends to play together, and this level adds 3 more users at just $5 each.
$50 - MEDIA - The digital images and story, Vixle Maker with 5 usernames and 1 year of hosting, the digital soundtrack of Vixle music, and the digital "Making of Vixle" art book. In addition, backers that later purchase a physical art book from our web store will have their edition personally signed and endorsed.
Examples of Vixle music created by Mike Jones:
$75 - SHIRT - The digital images, story, art book and soundtrack, Vixle Maker with 5 usernames and 1 year of hosting, and a specially designed t-shirt exclusively for backers at this level (and above), personally signed by both Kit and Brian. This level includes shipping anywhere in the U.S. for free. International shipping will be the cheapest we can find, with the difference billed separately at fulfillment time in July.
Limit T-Shirt Concept: Vixle Launch!
$100 - ALPHA - The digital images, story, art book and soundtrack, Vixle Maker with 5 usernames and 1 year of hosting, the signed t-shirt, and access to Vixle starting with the Alpha release, estimated in September, and your name will appear in the credits.  In addition, you'll have the option to join our tester program, which gives you the ability to view and update our bug lists, and we'll communicate with you frequently to solve problems and get your feedback, so that you can help shape Vixle.
All of the following tiers are limited in quantity, and include everything in ALPHA.
$150 - CLUB - limited to 25 - You'll be able to sponsor a school or social club of your choice for one year, with a group account that includes 30 usernames. Unlike personal accounts, group accounts become inactive if not renewed. For larger clubs, you can pledge an additional $50 for each additional 10 members.
$500 - MAKER - limited to 10 - Kit and Brian will work with you to create a custom character or object, along with interesting animations and code to go with it. Your creation will be included in the Vixle catalog, so that all Vixle Maker users will be able to add it to their own worlds. If desired, your name will be displayed prominently in the title or description of your model.  We'll also have a 3D version of your model printed and sent to you, perfect for displaying.
$1000 - SCHOOL - limited to 5 - You'll be able to sponsor a middle or secondary school of your choice for the 2015/16 school year, with a group account that includes 250 usernames. Unlike personal accounts, group accounts become inactive if not renewed. You can add support for an additional 25 students for every additional $100 pledged.
$2500 - JAM - limited to 6 - Game jams are one of the great traditions of game development. Over the course of a weekend, the Vixle team will work side-by-side with you, day and night, to turn your game idea into a reality. You're the boss, you get to make the decisions. If you're local, you can choose to join us at the Pittsburgh office (location TBD), or we'll stay connected to you via Google Hangouts and Vixle (of course)! It'll be a blast, and we'll create a 3D print for you and us to commemorate the occasion.
The possibility for Vixle stretch goals is endless. The more support we get, the richer the platform becomes.  Here are a few to look forward to:
$60,000 - Vixle lives!
$70,000 - Add the ability to import and voxelize programs created with MIT's Scratch programming environment. Released in January.
$80,000 - Add a 4th Asset Pack in a genre chosen by the Vixle backers. Released with Beta.
$90,000 - Add a visual editor for customizing NPC behavior, such as path following, dialogue, trading, and state machines which heuristically govern mood. Released in February.
$100,000 - Finish the "Journey to Galaxy's Edge" trilogy with two more stories and related challenges. Released in February and April.
There's plenty more to announce, but let's not get ahead of ourselves.
What's in an Asset Pack?
An Asset Pack consists of at least 8 animated characters, 20 terrain textures, 40 objects, associated code, sounds, and one musical theme. Each character comes with at least one unique animation, in addition to standard animations like walking. All of the assets in a pack are thematically related, coming from a specific genre, such as Fantasy or Virtual Reality.  Vixle backers at BETA and above will receive at least 5 Asset Packs, between the original three, and the two they'll get during the first year of hosting, plus any unlocked by stretch goals.
What's the difference between a world and a game?
A world is the physical space you create, for users to visit and explore. Within your world, you can build games to play. Games can be ongoing activities that users engage in while visiting, such as capture the flag, paintball, or nurturing pets. They can also be structured experiences with an explicit start and end, like a board game, or a platformer with levels.
Brian likes to create worlds as virtual amusement parks, where the games take the role of rides. This format encourages visitors to come see what's new, and at the same time play their old favorites. In the end, you decide what your world is like.
Some users may choose to create multiple worlds, either to keep them thematically separate, or because they have different groups of people they like to experience them with. Vixle Maker allows you to create as many worlds as you like, but hosting is billed on a per world basis.
What's the difference between an account and a username?
An account is used for billing, and is managed by whomever is "in charge", such as a parent or teacher. Each account has several usernames permanently associated with it, one for each person who uses Vixle.
Hosting is billed on a per-account basis, and allows the users of that account to host a number of their worlds online. Hosting allows a personal account to host one world online for $1 per month. The first year of hosting is free, and users can change which world they are hosting at any time.
As an example, a family of five that uses Vixle together would need a single account with 5 usernames. For $1 per month, they could host one world online and work on it together. If each member wanted their own hosted world, the cost would be $5 per month, although we expect to offer volume discounts in such cases.
Do all usernames associated with an account have to be part of the same household?
No, your extra username is a great way to invite a friend to use Vixle with you.
What's the difference between a personal and group account?
All of the backer tiers offer personal accounts, except for the CLUB and SCHOOL tiers, which offer both an personal account to the backer, and a group account for the organization of their choice.
Personal accounts remain active even if you choose not to renew hosting, so you'll always be able to use Vixle Maker to build and play games.  Hosting for personal accounts is $1 per world per month.
Group accounts are subscription-based, and become inactive if not renewed.  The cost of Hosting for group accounts is included, and allows every member to host one world.
What happens if I don't renew hosting?  Do I lose access to Vixle or my games?
No, your hard work belongs to you. With a personal account, you will always be able to use Vixle Maker to continue building and playing your games, even networked on your LAN. Only free Vixle Explorer users won't be able to play your game. Vixle includes import and export options to common formats, so you can also take your work to professional game development programs, and vice versa.
Will children under 13 be able to use Vixle online?
Yes, with caveats. The account holder will need to verify their parent relationship to the child. Once verified, we will provide a variety of parental controls to customize who your children can interact with online, and how. All controls will default to the most conservative settings, for added safety.
Where are all the physical rewards?
They're in another castle. We did significant research into the costs of a variety of cool physical rewards, but sadly the numbers didn't work out. As a small software company, there are no bargains on physical goods that we can pass along to you.  If we had added physical goods and shipping to our most popular backer levels, our funding target would have increased by 40%.
We still love swag, so we plan to sell non-limited Vixle t-shirts, folders, prints, art books, and soundtracks via our web store, opening in July. Otherwise, there's the SHIRT tier, which will get you a limited edition t-shirt. And don't forget that backers of the MEDIA tier that later order a physical copy of the art book can have their edition signed and endorsed!
Where does my money go?
By keeping our costs tight, we can put 83% of your pledges directly toward the development of Vixle. The distribution changes based on stretch goals we unlock, but if we raise $60k, it looks like this:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As software projects go, Vixle has a relatively high complexity due to the number of features and platforms being supported, especially given that Brian is currently the only engineer. However, Brian has 18 years of experience building and launching complex Internet software, and is one of the engineers Google trusted to work solo in a remote office.

Complex software projects also tend to become delayed. In this case, we've waited to launch our Kickstarter until all of the potential show-stoppers were addressed. We built the game Auger to demonstrate that the Vixle core is nearly ready. LAN support and better project management will round out the core. From there, each additional feature (e.g. voxel editor, character animator, block code interface) is independent and incremental, meaning that if delays do occur, they will be on the order of days or weeks, rather than months. In addition, an early and active alpha test community will ensure that our progress is communicated clearly.

One of the selling points of Vixle, is our claim that it will be powerful enough for experts, but still accessible to middle-school children on their own. Brian would go insane with boredom if the former weren't the case. He is also a regular sponsor of the local middle school game design club, and will continue to tailor Vixle based on first-hand observations this fall, while students learn to use it for the first time.

Note: This update offers a deep look into our thoughts on how to handle animation in Vixle. Backers that are not curious about technical details can safely skip it.
Vixle attempts to minimize the learning curve of every aspect of game creation. Thanks to predecessors like Minecraft, Scratch, Qubicle, Bfxr, Blip Synthesizer and many others, there are well-tested ways for novices to create worlds, code, models, sound effects, and music.
One of the notable exceptions is animation. I have yet to stumble across a really intuitive interface to handle the rigging, skinning, and keyframing needed to animate modern 3D models. Internally, we've been using to animate Vixle models. Blender is free and powerful, but can be very challenging for novices (and some experts). We have ideas on how to make the process more accessible, but a lot of experimentation and playtesting is still needed.

In the past week we've added some great features to the Vixle Modeler (including 3D printing!), live-modeled some steampunk, and started conversations around getting Vixle in schools.
